description:
Solid food at this price point. 

Just watch out for the local bums outside when they sometimes wander inside.  The outside patio is a nice touch if you don't mind the smell of shit and piss from the bums while you eat.
author: Ricardo O.

description: Was not a big fan earlier but i have grown to like them. Lot of my colleagues love this place so we end up coming here anyway.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Tried this place out on Hockey Jersey BOGO deal day.

The make a big Burrito. A little slow but anything in SF is bad at lunch.

Staff is friendly and the location seems clean.
author: John J.

description: If good smelling dog food tasted as good as you wanted it to taste, it would taste like barbacoa at Chipotle.
author: Rob G.

description: Don't find my order which was placed a while ago,delayed experience no point of placing the order online.I am big fan of chipotle,it's a routine failure in all the chipotle.
author: Pranay K.

description:
So, I have a confession to make... I love Chipotle! This particular location gave so much food and I truly enjoyed the service of the employees. There's plenty of seating inside and it is clean. Clean is hard to find when in most parts of the Financial District. Great spot to grab lunch or dinner when you're working or visiting the city.

2016 Review #90
author: Stephanie G.

description:
So, chipotle is chipotle. The food was fine, as to be expected. What I didn't love about the place was how messy and noisy it is. I could hardly hear the girl behind the counter over other people talking, traffic and how loud the music is!! 
The was a lot of trash all over the benches downstairs and we didn't realise there was an upstairs so we just sat at a dirty table and ate.
author: Rowena B.

description:
This review is just on the food. The service has always been 4-5 star.
I've been to this location many times as I work in the building it's in. I usually get the Chicken Bowl with corn and noticed lately that it keeps getting more and more spicy each time I go, to the point my tongue is burning today. I've tried the order without corn, and it's still to spicy. I wish they would tone down the amount of spice they put into the food.
author: Bob P.

description: This place... I am just speechless. Twice I ordered from this place through their website and they got it wrong. Last time I asked for Bowl with white rice, cheese, lettuce, steak and guacamole. I got everything but the steak. How they forgot the steak... I don't know. Today I had to work late and since this place is still open, I decided to try this place again. I ordered the same thing. They gave me beans, corns and cilantro which I absolutely dislike and did not ask for. They did not give me any guacamole. Where is my guacamole?? See pictures for proof.
author: Julia J.

description: I like Chipotle for a quick bite to eat, but I think the vegetable bowl/burrito should be more generous on toppings or at least cheaper than the meat options...
author: Ben B.

description:
Never was a fan of Chipotle before since first trying it in a suburban Virginian mall - always thought it was sterile Mexican. The fast-casual chain started to grow on me however as a convenient spot for a quick lunch by my old office. 

Now that we've moved, I really miss it. Nothing wrong with a brown rice bowl, grilled chicken, lettuce, some fresh tomato and corn salsa topped with a little cheese and sour cream. The flavor are bright and it's a satisfying lunch. Even the Sofritas braised tofu is really hearty and tasty for a non meat option. 

The lines at lunch are misleadingly long because it does move pretty quickly along the assembly line. Fresh and tasty, in and out for under $10 lunch. I have more "authentic" Mexican options by the new office but I do miss my dependable rice bowls here.
author: Jon L.

description:
What can I say - I given Chipotle enough chances and after today's B.S. I am done.  This review is more for me so as to remind myself as to why it is that I am done with Chipotle.

Today, after doing a little shopping at Westfield, when returning to my office I got off the bus in front of Chipotle and thought for about 1 hot second of running in to order food then I decided to go to Rico Mex in the alley on Stevenson behind Chipotle.  

To my dismay, I found out that my favorite Mexican lunch spot "Rico Mex," my go to place, is no more (they lost their lease (thanks GREEDY F-in San Francisco property owners)).  8^(
As such, I thought about my options and went to Caramba on 2nd Street and to my dismay they were closed for the holiday (hopefully).  I then made a stage right and went to Uno Mas.  

Upon entering Uno Mas I notice a few people in front of me, I waited about 5 minutes forever, then exhausted from listening to the two babbling ladies in front of me who couldn't make up their minds, I made a stage exit left.  Okay, now where? Chipotle I guess it is.

Entering Chipotle I notice three guys in front of me, no biggy, there are several employees behind the counter, certainly one of them will pay attention and notice the small line forming and  will start processing the order of the next customer.  I waited.  Finally in what took like it was forever (I think the other two guys in front of me were thinking the same and likely had the same look on their face) an employee looked at us and placed on the gloves and starting taking orders.  The guy in front of me ordered exactly what I wanted and I took notice of the heaping spoonful of chicken placed over rice along with the heaping spoonful of pico de gallo the employee slapped into the bowl and thought to myself "Cool, I'm definitely ordering the chicken bowl."  

This employee is now waiting on me and I asked for the same as the person in front of me and what did I get, heaping spoonful of rice, ¼ spoonful of scraps of chicken scrapped from the bottom of the tin bucket, ¼ spoonful of pico de gallo and very little lettuce.  I stopped the first employee and said "is that all the chicken you have?"  

Because not everyone is a mind reader, what I really meant was, and should have asked "Do you have freshly cooked chicken?  I don't want the cold meat your scrapping from what is left in the bottom of the bucket." But - I didn't ask this exact question and instead of getting the real answer I wanted, instead I got, "yeah, we have more but you have to pay extra for it.  It's $2.50 extra."  ????wha????

I had a questionable look on my face because in my head I was thinking of telling her to forget it and walk out.  But I couldn't, I was out of lunch options and had to get back to work.  

I thought of the warm chicken and agreed to the extra $2.50 charge (though mind you, the guy in front of me got a heaping spoonful of chicken at the regular price; albeit cold chicken).  The two employees behind the counter helping me with my order acted as if my order was of great inconvenience to them when I asked for more pico de gallo and lettuce in the bowl.  

Really????  I'm here to purchase a HOT lunch item and instead get cold scraps from the bottom of the tin bucket and a bad attitude to boot when I ask for what I want.  Really???? What part of I'm here to PURCHASE a HOT lunch item is of contention.

When going to pay, the two employees made sure to yell out that I ordered extra chicken and it was a $2.50 extra charge.  At that point, I made my complaint to the young lady at the register - and told her this has happened to me before in the past.  This complaint was met with, "Okay, we will make a note of it and remind us next time you're in."  Ahhh, me thinks NOT!!!  

This is the third and final time for Chipotle.   I'm DONE - I'm O U T  T H E  D O O R!
author: Cris B.

description:
Chipotle has become one of my favorite go to spots for lunch. The deliciousness and freshness of food items, friendly staff along with service efficiency continues to be consistent. I like that their chicken meat is well seasoned and flavorful. One other thing I do like is the cleanliness of the facility. Good first experience here so I'll definitely be back.

Chicken Tacos with seasoned chicken meat and shredded cheese on soft flour tortilla is delicious and I enjoyed it.
author: Bennett W.

description: Why do they always overcook the food at this location?  Sometimes burnt chicken and today is burnt veggies.  Burnt food is bad for anyone's health!
author: Yen F.

description:
Hmmm what can I say about Chipotle? Don't think I've ever had a bad experience at a chipotle. This was an extra great experience because my friend and I were hard core craving chipotle and had a BOGO coupon (!!!!!!) so it may or may not have the been the best day ever. 

Went all out this time and got a burrito which was definitely the greatest decision i made that day. The staff was awesome and loaded my burrito to the max--so much that I was not able to finish it (which I almost always do) but i knew I would love myself later that night when I got home from going out and needed some munchies-and boy did I love myself. CHIPOTLE FOR THE WIN.
author: Ilana B.

description:
Very caddy service. I was upsold on their "quesoritto" but all they did was melt the cheese on  a burrito. It was my understanding that a quesoritto was a burrito wrapped in a quesadilla. It was super wasn't. 
When I asked, "so a quesoritto is just melted cheese, and you charge an extra 3.50 for that?" The person responded with "uhhh.. yes" like I was the idiot! WTF
author: Ben Z.

description: Unos Dos Tacos just a block away and the taste, quality and value is MUCH BETTER. I've never paid so much for Chipotle in my life. The first bite of my taco was a fatty piece of chicken. They were a complete mess to eat. I should have known! NEVER AGAIN CHIPOTLE!
author: Tina P.

description:
I've been working in the area for a while now and sampled most of the lunch options around. At the end of 3 months I realized that Chipotle hit the sweet spot of location, price, quality, quantity, and consistency. It's a short walk from my work, its under $10, food is good and there's plenty of it, and every time I walk in I know i'm going to have the same pleasant experience as the day before. Yes, I eat here practically every day. 
As far as how this location compares to the other Chipotles, I think it's one of the best. The line moves quickly and efficiently, everyone working is nice and friendly, plenty of seating even on busy days, and consistently great music playing through the speakers (I've heard everything from Alt-J to Darkside).
author: Boris K.

description:
Not all Chipotle restaurants are created equal. While the food quality and recipe execution is fairly consistent across all restaurants, the customer service and order prep speed vary from restaurant to restaurant. The Chipotle at 525 Market St. beats out most other Chipotle's in order prep speed.

I've ordered almost every burrito/burrito bowl and taco at this location. The quality is always very good - what you'd expect from Chipotle. Since this place is ground zero of the financial district of SF, the lines are oftentimes extremely long. Nevertheless, this location gets customer in and out in record time.

For example, a Chipotle at a different location that has 18 customers in line could easily take 15 to 25 minutes to get them in and out. This location would get those 18 customers in and out in about 6 to 9 minutes. How do they do it? They hire fast workers and they have a guy standing behind the speedy assembly line and making sure that it's moving along at peak speed.
author: Charles A.

description: Love ordering with the mobile app.  You can read the health inspection notes as you wait.  Inspector wanted the blood cleaned from a table!  Maybe just hot sauce.
author: Defn N.

description: This is a basic Chipotle. Nothing too special here I always find Chipotle's to be pretty consistent and this one is just that. I order my meals through the app and pick it up during the time I want for lunch, so I have more time to eat and have never had a problem. They seem to skimp out on the meat sometimes during the rush hour, but I'm not complaining it happens at all Chipotle's I visit. It's very close to my work, so this place is very convenient for me. The store itself is pretty unique and clean. Overall, this isn't super 100% authentic Mexican food, but I enjoy it and will sure to be visiting this spot more than once during my time working around this area.
author: James R.

description:
i enjoy Chipotles, too bad this spot is less than stellar.

a customer before me clearly hasn't been to Chipotle before and don't know how this works. when the worker asked what kind of meat, the customer said i don't want meat. instead of informing her that they have tofu as well, she skipped to the next item.

when i check out i used a code for free chips and guac. after ringing up i only realized the code wasn't input and i got charge for the extra items. no big deal, they refunded me. but why can't the cashier guy tell me if the code didn't work and just ring up the whole thing?
author: YY M.

description:
Uhmm nothing special, just the "free" guac and chips that I won from their website from a promo to win back customers.

Only thing that is annoying is how they roll burritos! They never fail with serving me a sloppy looking burrito.
author: X M.

description: LOVE.
author: Angela L.

description: Chipotle is one of the name I have been listening even when I stayed in india. Most of my friends suggest to go this restaurant for the tasty bowl or burito. Finally I landed up and taste a bowl. Yes all my friends are correct . Bowl is really tasty and am satisfied with their menu.
author: Sandeep R.

description:
You'd think, given their recent troubles and their decision to give away a bunch of free food as a way of luring customers back, that when I actually decide to eat here and pay for their food, they wouldn't be so stingy with it.

I came at 1:40pm on Friday, November 11th.  I don't know any other way to identify the people that served me other than to say a young Asian-American female made my tacos and a young Asian-American male rang me up.  I commented to both of them that there was almost no filling in the tacos, but they kinda laughed it off. Hungry, and not in the mood to make a scene or disrupt the assembly line, I just took my stupid, anemic tacos that wouldn't even fill a toddler's belly and went on about my business.

I finished my food and I'm still hungry.  I'm literally going to go eat elsewhere or go back to my office and nibble my way through the snack kitchen, since my $8.32 bought me about half the amount of food it bought the people before and after me.
author: Jay S.

description: Poor location. Ordered double chicken burrito and instead received a burrito bowl with the regular amount of chicken. If you want your order made correctly and don't want to waste money on unfulfilled extras, try a different location. Lady at the register was nice, however, she gets the lone star for this spot.
author: Victor H.

description:
Great for the FiDi lunch run! 

Nice seating area and on spot clean counters as well as tables!

Their steak was well sauced and tasty with the burrito bowl rice and beans!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I'm sorry but this place should not even come up when you search margaritas on yelp. This might be biased but I promise this story is worth the read:

After having dinner in the area, my old uncle who recently got a smart phone and downloaded the yelp app suggested we should continue drinking and go to this "margarita place" nearby that he found on yelp and heard from friends. I love margaritas and a night cap drink so I was super excited to try this joint out! After driving 15 minutes and trying to find parking in the area, my uncle and I arrive to this supposedly awesome margarita place and find out 1. It's closed and 2. It's fucking chipotle. Yes it's my wrong for not even asking what the place is called, but still..... 

I have nothing to say about the food because you either like it or you don't, but after really getting a margarita at this place the next morning I am baffled that this is under good margaritas in yelp. Yes it wasn't a bad patron margarita for like 8 dollars but this does not make chipotle in any way a MARGARITA place. They are a place that serves margaritas! Id rather go to Chevys or e bar for a margarita joint than here. 

Disclaimer: I know this isn't a margarita place and don't mean to be hard on Chipotle that is a very successful establishment well known by most as fast food Mexican but for any people who don't really know this place like my uncle, I want to save you and your loved ones the time of driving and getting your thirst unfulfilled by saying this is NOT a Margarita Joint!!! It's freaking Chipotle!!!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: See the pic.  At first I thought it was a piece of band-aid, YUCK!! Luckily I it isn't but who knows.....ever find a random object in your burrito???
author: Brian K.

description:
I ordered the barbacoa tacos, but into one and had to check where I was. I thought maybe I wondered to The Salt House as this stuff was horrendous salty.
I've learned my lesson
author: Mark N.

description:
Definitely one star.
I waited in line for 15 minutes only to discover that your guys are out of chicken.
Great you till me to wait 10 minutes so you can cook more chicken.
In the middle of lunch time.
author: Jermaine E.

description: Another one bites the dust for me! 2nd time in a row when the salad bowl was crap and sub par. Many pieces of black lettuce that tells me it's time to throw out from my fridge at home..but they expect me to pay almost 10.00 and eat it here!! Right!! Brought it back and got brown rice bowl instead with like..1/2 cup rice..makes the bowl just taste like a bowl of slop!!this will be my last trip to this chipotle FOR SURE!!
author: Kathleen G.

description: Loved my burrito!!! Absolutely fantastic and I love the way that they let you decide what goes inside.  Especially the roasted corn!  They wrap the burritos in foil so you can eat it with one hand like a sandwich. While this doesn't always work (as they sometimes fall apart) it's great while it lasts. This location gets a lot of business but they handle it very well. Great job!
author: Sandra P.

description:
The New Montgomery location is closer to me, but I walk a few blocks to this once for the service, portions, and amount of seating. Also during slow hours it's not busy like the other one that's filled with students. The fast Asian girl who works the weekday afternoon shift consistently gives an adequate amount food and sometimes more. Portions are A+ and what every Chipotle should give.

One thing that they could work on is slowing down a bit when there isn't a rush. Several times the workers have messed up my order by going too fast and mistaking that I asked for an item when I didn't. 

This is a solid Chipotle.
author: Vicky C.

description:
I mean it's chipotle so obviously it's delicious! Food is amazing. Typical chipotle...choose your own ingredients in order to make the perfect burrito or burrito bowl that your little heart desires. The ingredients are always fresh and tasty. 

Cons of this location: super long lines during the lunch rush and sometimes they run out of ingredients during this time due to high demand. 

Tips:
-avoid the lunch rush and you're A-OK!
author: Sami F.

description: Does anyone else have issues with their chicken always being so fatty? I've eaten a lot of chipotle... I love it. But this is the only location I've ever encountered having to throw most of my burrito away (on several occasions) because their chicken the provide is so chewy and fatty. Not sure why this is different from other locations but I'm going to start trying other locations out.
author: Scott K.

description: Excellent tasting food with large portions of the standard chipotle options.  Food is prepared quickly.
author: Naveen N.

description:
Crappiest Buritto I have ever had...rice was undercooked, burrito was cold, and beans were hard. How could you sell this crap!!! Not edible...threw it in the garbage.

Food is also prepared by what looks like a bunch of underpaid college kids who just don't give a rats ass!

Ugh...
author: John R.

description: Love this place! The burrito bowl is my favorite, because the servers put more ingredients in the bowl versus the burrito.
author: Lance H.

description:
Chipotle is delish!!! It's not something I would typically eat on the reg but for ghe once in a blue moon craving it's literally next door to my bldg and it gets quite popular among the working crowd. The line starts to form pretty early and it's probably one of the busiest spots I've seen in the area. By 11:30ish it's fairly busy and stays that way until about 1. It can vary but from what I've seen overall its very busy during the lunch hour and the dining room gets full! There's also an outside patio area. It's pretty nice!

The dining room is pretty nice and they are extremely fast during that lunch hour. They move the line very quickly to keep it going. I usually like eating the burrito bowl with brown rice and lettuce but sometimes I change it up! This location has the new sofritas tofu which is pretty good! Worth trying if out like tofu. Tastes good with the fajita veggies!
author: Priya S.

description: there is something wrong with this location.  seriously.  the first time i ate here, the carne asada was not cooked.  the second time i ate here, the meat was hard as rubber.  i really do like chipotle, but this location has got to get it together.
author: David M.

description:
I don't know how you rate Chipotle because it's a chain. As long as they have corn salsa I will never complain. 

Just a few notes: 

It's gets super busy during lunch. The line is ridiculously long. Surprisingly, they make their food extremely fast and you can get to the front in no time.

There is plenty of dining space (1st and 2nd floor)

If you plan on using the bathroom there make sure you get a receipt after purchase (you'll need the code at the bottom to get in)
author: Ida H.

description: Not bad food for a chain. Quick and convenient. I like their chips and guacamole. I think Chipotle as a whole used to be better, but it's still a pretty good spot to eat at.
author: Sven S.

description: Stingy with rice and beans and meat, the backbone of the burrito. Disappointing after seeing people in front with multiple orders get showered with ingredients.
author: Gabriel O.

description:
In general, I like Chipotle; it's a nice alternative when looking for something quick but relatively healthy. Although, I am done with this location. This location in SF (on Market St) is busy to say the least and I get that they need to move people along but time after time after time, they sacrifice customer service and quality just to get you in and then out.

How hard is it to assemble a "bowl to go"?  Apparently, very hard. My only suggestion to this establishment is pay attention to your customer while you are helping them. Scoop those corn nibblets out of the sour cream while your at it. How about NOT making me repeat EVERYTHING twice because you are not focusing on your job. Now that would be refreshing.

I'm done.
author: Tracie S.

description: Clean place. Food was good, but extremely small portions!! Being in the city where you have to pay more I definitely think I didn't get my money worth, still hungry!
author: Grant M.

description: Went to this location for lunch after shopping at the mall. I had a voucher that I won from a school fundraising event for a Buy One Get One Free burrito. The manager refused to honor it reasoning that she has never seen it before. I know you want to maximize your store profits and cut cost but hey ... I thought Chipotle is all about supporting your local communities ??? I was quite disappointed for that ... I still paid for my own burrito but hey ... Please do not tell me next time you are supporting your local communities because you are not my DEAR !!!
author: Annie L.

description:
You know, I was considering giving Whiteypotle downtown an extra star solely for being open till 9 on weekdays when everything else around here but 7-11 and that crappier of the two McDonalds folds up as soon as the bridge n' tunnlers are out. Useful when you have to catch a late Butthound or Golden Gate up out of this ridiculous fiefdom. 

But damn, man, is the value horrible for how much they charge. I never go to Chipotles, are they all this expensive or is this just an SF thing? 7-8 bucks for a burrito or bowl I can let slide on Market St. if the portions are at least decent ... but 3.50 just for chips and guac? Fuck off Chipotle. So you want me to pay like 12 or 13 bucks all up for an inferior version of something that real taquerias charge literally half as much for. 

Look white people, I understand if you're in Omaha or Fargo or something and this is the best you can do for Mexican. There's no excuse anywhere in California though. Overcome your trepidation and go to a real taqueria owned and staffed by real Mexicans so you can understand how terrible this is by comparison.
author: Jeremy H.

description: The food was tasting little fun within the next day I have to call out of work since I got food poisoning and I won't go back
author: Valentino G.

description:
Hilariously, the server here just informed me that my choice of a vegetarian burrito wasn't a 'real' burrito, and that I should probably go to Subway instead.

The irony of a Chipotle server suggesting that something wasn't a 'real' burrito was not lost on me.
author: Max S.

description: Very rude service ! This is close to my school but the ladies working here make me not want to return. The girl working today spoke so fast I could barely understand her and she got Angry when I didn't understand what she was asking. Me . If you don't like your job , find something you do like because it's obvious . Next time I won't come here to be treated like an annoyance ...
author: Mariangeles C.

description: They need to learn how to fold a burrito. There's too much salt in everything. Manager were pretty rude she was getting mad at her employee I was here at 8:30 pm January 5 2016. Hopefully they'll learn how to fold a burrito at least.
author: Hardish S.

description: I decided to try a different Chipotle location after a few bad experiences at the New Montgomery location.  I had a great experience at this location.  The brown rice was cooked and seasoned nicely, the flavor of the salsas was better, and the portion was larger.  I'll be going to this one from now on.  I can't really think of a reason to take away a star, especially after they removed all artificial preservatives from their food.  They do use some oils that I don't use at home, but that's not enough to alter my five star rating.  The next improvement I'm waiting for is whole wheat tortillas.
author: Nader Z.

description:
4 years have passed since my last review but the verdict remains the same --worst chipotle location. 

Same small portions of meat. Today I decided to try their new menu item (chorizo) since they never add new stuff! Exciting, right? Not really. The only way I can describe this stuff is cold "mystery meat" smothered in salty spices. The carnitas were also cold and dry (I got the bottom of the pan) and the potion was abysmal. I have always noted that the meat portions diminish as the employees start seeing the bottom of the metal container. 

My meal was really salty, lukewarm at best, and just overall unsatisfying. I will try to remember my own advice and stay away from this location.

==================



Worst Chipotle location I've experienced to this day. 

The wait is 20-30 minutes during lunch hour (without exaggeration). Basically you have to be prepared to spend your lunch break in line if you come here at noon.

To top off the wait, the employees have to frantically slap the ingredients to keep up with the orders...this makes for a poor result. My last burrito only had condiments on one end..

I love me some Chipotle but this location simply cannot keep up with the volume of fin. dist. patrons.
author: Nina M.

description: best chipotle I have been to.  faxed in the order.  easy pick up.  they didn't skimp on the ingredients like the one by my house (Pinole).  made to my specifications, just how like it.
author: Leo D.

description:
Standard Chipotle. 

I was mad at chipotle all summer so I wanted to try again, and I was craving their guacamole.  The line here can look long but it moves FAST! You can be in and out of there in less than 10 minutes even when the line is long.  

The staff is fast and efficient, no time to spare.  The food is standard chipotle and I haven't had an issue with it in the couple of times that I've been since!
author: Stephanie D.

description: Worst Chipotle on planet... Service is terrible, even for pick ups. Staff is rude and careless.
author: Logan A.

description:
Lemme talk about the new vegan style Sofritas.  It's soy bean infused with various spices and beans.  It tastes good when you eat it on its own bite but when combined into a burrito, the flavors get lost with the rice, black beans, salsa, and guacamole.  Thumbs down.

Side note and VERY important... this location runs out of cheese around 7pm.  I don't know about you but I like eating my burritos with cheese.  It doesn't feel complete without it.  Thumbs down.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Ordered a chicken bowl and a steak bowl.  They both are super delicious but, wow, are they every stingy on the portions you receive.

I swear I had about ten pieces of steak.

I think since a this location is so popular,  with lines out the door, they can get away with it but next time I'll go to a different  chipotle.

We came here today at 11:15 and there were about ten people in line.  By noon I've seen people waiting out the door.....
author: Foodlover B.

description: This chipotle seems to taste better than any other chipotle I've been too. I work a block away and during lunch the lines here are long but the employees quickly serve everyone within 10 minutes MAX. giving it 4 stars as the prices have recently increased at this particular location (steak bowl nearly $10 with NO guac!)
author: Ajit S.

description:
HAPPY (belated) NEW YEAR from Susan C. aka Susan Sparkles!   Another year of eating, dieting, and yelp-eliteing has begun! For my first review of the new year I pick...... 525 Market St. Chipotle!  Why? Because burritos are love http://www.yelp.com/list/burritos-are-love-san-francisco and Chipotle is my favorite guilty pleasure spot!

Now you might be thinking, "Dieting + Chipotle= burrito bowl or salad bowl."  WRONG!  Because burrito/salad bowls are so NOT love.
 
When you make a Chipotle burrito the Susan Sparkles way, burritos are love AND diet friendly!

The Susan Sparkles Chipotle Burrito:

-Tortilla: Because it's not a burrito without a tortilla. 
-Brown Rice: Yes, this location has brown rice! It is so tasty, healthy, and adds a little extra bite to the burrito.  
-Grilled Chicken: While having a few more calories than the beef options, this limits the saturated fat but you still get meat!
-Black beans: Everyone knows black beans have all kinds of healthy vitamins antioxidants.  Also more fiber and less salt than Chipotle's pinto beans.
-Mild Tomato Salsa AND Medium Salsa: This is the secret to extra flavor without the extra calories, these two salsas are the lowest in calorie at 35 calories for both!)
-Romaine Lettuce: Gives you that extra crunch and freshness.  It also beefs up your burrito so that you are more full for only 5 calories!

Total Calories of the whole Susan Sparkle Burrito: About 820cals

Now you might be thinking that 820 is a ton of calories.  Well Sparkles diet tip #1 is divide and conquer.  Split that massive hunk of burrito in half!  You also get two meals for the price of one! More burrito meals is love!

Here is how to ACTUALLY eat half the burrito:

1) Ask for an extra burrito foil and to go bag when you check out.
2) Lay some napkins down on any Chipotle surface to act as a cutting board/germ barrier.
3) Place your foil wrapped burrito on the napkin (Note: Whatever you do, don't remove the foil!)
4) Use the surprisingly sturdy Chipotle plastic knife to slice the foil covered burrito in half.
5) Wrap one half in extra foil and put it in the to go bag and roll up the bag to securely close it.
6) Nom the other half slowly so you get full faster.  Drink lots of water because it slows you down and there is a lot of sodium in burritos.
7) Feel REALLY guilty if you go through the trouble of unrolling the to go bag and take off two layers of foil to nom the other half.

Total Calories in half the Susan Sparkles Burrito: 410cals

While you can make a Susan Sparkles Burrito at any Chipotle, I like this one due to its location near my office (walking is healthy!), fast service (fidi line looks scary during lunch hour but the line moves surprisingly fast), and cleanliness despite the high volume.

Happy New Year Fellow Yelpers!
author: Susan C.

description:
My office is right next to this location so in order to get Chipotle I have to stay close because the line is always out the door.

What I've noticed about this location the last 6 months or so is how incredibly skimpy their bowls and burritos have gotten. For nearly $10 for a burrito come on, at least give me a full spoon full of rice and chicken. 

The service is good, but the employees act as if the food budget comes out of their own paychecks. This is the only location I've had this issue with. Other Chipotles I usually have left overs.
author: Jason M.

description: I had to take away a star because on two different occasions I got an avocado stem in my guacamole. One time it was two stems in one bowl, yuck! Aside from that, its the same delicious Chipotle you'd find anywhere else. Also, this location does accept the promo coupons, I was surprised since the coupons say they vary by location.
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
This Chipotle is definitely the best of the ones in the FiDi. The line is always long but don't let it scare you away. They are so fast and the line moves very quickly. If you can get there by 11:30 AM you won't be standing in line for very long at all. 

Tip: Order online and pick it up at the window. They always have my food ready at the time I ask for it to be ready. And you don't even have to go to the cashier like the other Chipotle locations make you do. They have a separate window you can go to where you pay and pick up so there's no mad people behind you thinking you cut in line.
author: Dusty N.

description:
I've dined at plenty of Chipotle restaurants and this one on Market St in SF........disappointing.

Every chicken bowl I've ordered had big chunks of chicken fat still left on the chicken.....the bite gets spit out......gross.

I also found a piece of what I THINK was soggy cardboard in my bowl.  Something soggy, brown, and inedible.   WTF?

The chips had SOOO much salt on them I had to tap each one to knock off some effing sodium crystals.

Not impressed and kinda disappointed in the quality.
author: Tracie S.

description:
Great for a quick lunch in FiDi. Typical chipotle restaurant. Food is always good (I love chipotle so I'm biased) and cheap when compared to other places around the area. 

One tip I suggest is to order food beforehand so you don't have to wait in line
author: Andrew C.

description: I've been coming to this location for a few years now. In the dozens of times I've visited, I've only had good experiences.
author: Mike A.

description: Chipotle burritos have crappy rice, incorrect proportions, and are not rolled correctly.   I really dislike eating here.
author: Michael E.

description:
As lunch options go, Chipotle is my usual standby. Anytime before 2pm is generally busy, but if you download the Chipotle app, you can preorder, thereby bypassing the line and moving straight to the register for pickup.

This location is frequented by businesspeople who often can't be bothered to say "please", "thank you", or exchange any sort of pleasantries with the person making their food. When greeted with a "Hi, how are you today?", the poor serviceperson is assailed with a machine-gunned litany of demands.

Aside from the fact that your Mom taught you better than that and it takes maybe two seconds to respond to the question and perhaps even ask how they're doing, you will often find that just by being nice, you will get a more generous scoop of whatever protein you select! 

Here are a couple of other hints for Chipotle: Quesadillas are not just for kids - they have a press to make them if you want one. You can also ask for extra tortillas on the side, ask for a side of the salad vinaigrette (they are pretty good in burrito bowls), or my favorite, ask for hard taco shells. Crunch them up and put them in your burrito bowl for texture, or to make a taco salad.

The service here is on point and super friendly, the food is fresh, relatively healthy, and it's delicious and inexpensive. Plus, if you're all about that liquid lunch (and you know who you are!) this Chipotle makes margaritas with Sauza for 4 and change, or for just over seven dollars, Patron, and there's no bartender to tip. What more could you want from a lunch joint in the FiDi?
author: Josh J.

description: Went here during the lunch rush hour before the line went out the door. Before stopping here I tried the chipotle closest to my office on California St...definitely wouldn't suggest that place between 12-1, the lines are slow. This chipotle line does move quickly, but give smaller portions than most chipotles I've been too..even the rice! Overall, the food is still of chipotle quality, just small portions.
author: Jessica S.

description: Chipotle started going downhill once it started charging customers an extra $3.50 for a quesarito. I've been boycotting them ever since. #freethequesarito
author: Nikki W.

description:
A solid and consistent chipotle location.

Just make sure that anytime between 11:30 AM and 2 PM you use your iPhone app or online ordering. they have a separate window for that and you'll be great passing the 30-something person line. (try not to do a dance or eat in front of them. they might maul you.)
author: Mike V.

description:
Line can get long, but if you HAVE to have Chipotle and in this area, be sure to come during offpeak hours. When the line is out the door, it's about 10 minutes to get your food. The employees take it like champs and are always friendly though. And they're fast! But high foot traffic means the only way they could make it faster would probably be to have a second kitchen. 

Seating is decent and it's nice to sit outside (umbrellas!) or inside (glass ceilings!)

To people complaining about small portions:

If you want more, ASK FOR IT. They are probably trained to put a specific amount of food in each order. More often than not, I'm sure more food would go to waste if they gave everyone huge portions.

Coming from someone who worked in the food/customer service industry, A SMILE, "PLEASE/THANK YOU" GOES A LONGGG WAY. I almost always ask for a little extra and never have issues. Just be nice and a little compassionate and you should be good to go. I can't imagine every single employee loves the crazy pace at Chipotle and other restaurants. So be patient and understanding. :)
author: David P.

description: Downstairs in my building? Does my first week get any better? In a reg. Here so don't need to say too much. Service and quality of food is alway consistent.  I like to get the tacos so I can get different types of meat and add extra GUAC.
author: JJ S.

description:
It is a standard Chipotle (always good) BUT you better have your order MEMORIZED TO A POINT. Cuz when lunchtime comes around.... the lines are way past the door. Somehow, you get to the front in less than 15 minutes? The reason is because they literally scream at you your choices and you recite in less than 30 seconds "Burrito bowl! Brown rice! Steak! Pinto! Guac! Medium salsa! Corn! Lettuce!!!!!!"  And then you're out the door before you know it.

It is so stressful I feel like I'm in a minute-to-win-it contest. Oh well I usually win though, with a pretty damn tasty burrito bowl!
author: Emily C.

description: Chipotle is always a safe bet. This particular location is pretty damn good. The lines at lunchtime can be daunting so I order ahead using their app. My order is always ready on time - hot and tasty. Jose mans the pick-up window and I guarantee he will put a smile on your face!
author: prior O.

description:
I am done with this place.
Their ingredients are no longer organic.
They slap it together like slop on an assembly line.
They charge extra for a tiny bag of stale tortilla chips.
If you order the salad version of anything, it's from the bag of lame chopped lettuce, so you get pale, colorless, nutrient free strings of "lettuce".
And they let the chicken product sit under heat lamps that are not hot enough. The chicken was dried out. And I got montezumas revenge.

And for this I paid nearly $15!?!?!?
author: Mike C.

description:
Strike three, they're out!

After three attempts, I still won't wait in the long line. It's ridiculous. People were standing in the rain waiting for this. I asked one guy. He said, "We have free coupons."
Funny it's labeled as "Mexcian." Has anyone ever eaten a burrito in Mexico? If so, where? I've never seen one there, not in DF, not in Baja, not in Jailisco, not in Guerrero, and not in the Yucatan. nowhere.

This American eatery seems popular, but at the same time, it's a sad analogy of the terrible state of lunch options in the downtown of a city that labels itself a culinary capital. San Francisco, get real with yourself.
author: Brian J.

description: There is no half star or I would give it. There are stingy workers here at this location and the food does not even level to the rim of the bowl when they are all done. Even when you tell me that you want everything on it, they ask you again for each ingredient. $8.75 for the bowl hardly fills the stomach.
author: Tulsi P.

description:
I've had a few of their burritos over the last couple of weeks and I have to say, they're really good!

I recently had a very disappointing meal at El Farolito and when Chipotle was listed by 7x7 Magazine as another great burrito place, I was a bit skeptical.  I first had Chipotle about 10 years ago and hadn't really been back since - I guess I thought it was okay, but nothing fantastic.  It was nice to try it again and this time I actually did appreciate it a bit more.

I've had their Barbacoa and Grilled Chicken burritos and they were great - tasted fresh, the cilantro rice was a nice and unique touch and the portion is very satisfying.

While I won't say that Chipotle has the best burritos in town, I will say that they are very good for a fast-food chain restaurant.  The customer service is also good and at $6.50 for almost any of their main items, it's a great deal in the Financial District.
author: Ken G.

description:
What's to like:
1.  Consistent fresh tex-mex made from quality ingredients.
2.  Their guacamole.   Mmmm,,,,
3.  The staff is professional and polite.
4.  All around one of the better large scale restaurant chains.

What's not to like:
1.  The line can be  long.
2.  This Chipotle could use more seating.
author: Mark D.

description:
Day "I forget" of the try-a-new-lunch-place-every-day challenge. Chipotle isn't new to me, but one of my coworkers had never been before. What?! 

Like a savvy pro, we ordered online and went to the pick up window. 5 minutes later we walked out with our food. Take that people standing in line for 45 minutes! On that note, every time I come here, the line is way out the door. The Chipotle on New Montgomery usually doesn't have a line this crazy. In any case, I am currently inhaling my fajita burrito bowl and it is delicious. Love their corn salsa!

On a side note, if you are ever planning a group lunch meeting, their online group ordering system is seriously one of the best I have seen.
author: Rachel E.

description:
I hate to ding this place because I really do like it. The line usually moves very fast and the people at the registers are pleasant. I always order the same thing -- burrito bowl with chicken, fajita style. A little off-menu, but really tasty.

But seriously -- if I want to add guacamole to my order, you're charging me $2 extra? TWO DOLLARS for a dollop of guac? That is insane. Overpriced, and not worth it. So sadly I will have to do without my guac or bring some with me to put on my order.
author: Lori M.

description:
If you build it - white people will come. That seems to be a truism for Chipotle. 

Don't worry - I'm not here to write a more latino than though review of Chipotle as being some whitewashed Mexican food (I saved that review for Nick's Crispy tacos). 

You will be hard-pressed to go here between 1130-130pm and not see at least 30 people in line for Chipotle. I have to say - the food is actually pretty good. I am particularly fond of their bowls. For about $6 you'll get what is essentially a deconstructed burrito: rice, choice of meat, beans, corn, sour cream, salsa etc. The seasoning of their carne asada is actually quite good. I would say it's the best I have had for a chain restaurant. 

My only gripe with chipotle is that for being a Mexican grill they don't have any aguas frescas like pineapple, watermelon, tamarind or horchata. 

Other than that - great place to have lunch if you can stomach the lines.
author: Carlos A.

description:
I have tried in-person and also with Web-Order few times for this location. I never found a complain...People loves Chipotle and that's reason for being it crowded during break hours. But the way staff handles it, I am impressed with that.

Sometimes, I have seen people showing attitude and rude speech at counter-person but they never lost smile for a moment. Even though its part of their job, its really difficult to maintain your temper level for everyone.
author: Sawan P.

description:
I rarely come here but when I do it's only for the convenience. Chipotle is fast food and you know you've entered a fast food line when your average wait time is less than 5 minutes for your food. During lunch time a guy comes by and takes for your order on a handheld if you're paying with a credit card. He uses a "line buster" to speed up the ordering process. 

I ordered a steak burrito with cheese, pinto beans, and rice. For $6.50 it's about the same size as a large burrito at most places. I don't know if it's authentic enough though. If you do go to any Chipotle, you'll notice that the menu is really simple to navigate. First pick your type of food, then the type of meat, and finally the type of extras you want in it.
author: Tim G.

description:
Do you like to wait in a long line at lunch only to walk away with a cold burrito? 

I honestly don't see the draw to this place. The line is out the door at lunch. 

They hire the dumbest people to assemble food here. It's not like the menu is extenstive-burrito, taco, bowl. Learn to roll a burrito for god's sake. 

The coldest mexican food $7 can buy. The cheese never melts.
author: L v.

description: They ran out of chicken and it was terrible! Three stars mainly because I seem to always keep coming back.  However I wish chipotle really had a better standard across all their restaurants.  Recommend the carnitas with sofrita.
author: Jason C.

description:
Quick and decent service.

Prices reasonable.

Fresh tasting chips.

Quacamole not that bad.

Chicken burrito w/ extra sour cream and rice ..tasty and filling.
author: Dani D.

description:
This Chipotle is okay. It's right on Market so I'm pretty sure it can get really busy here throughout the day. We got here right before they closed and they were really chill and let us take our time ordering. 

We came to this specific Chipotle because they serve margaritas here. They serve it in a little plastic cup and didn't have any salt on it but there was a good amount of alcohol in it for the size of the cup. 

Pros:
- Right on Market, between Embarcadero and Montgomery bart
- Seating outside, with a nice view of tall buildings and a fountain 

Cons:
- Door to the seating area is really stiff so we thought it was locked 
- Need to be buzzed in to use the bathroom but it's free
author: Paul U.

description:
Never visited this location due to the long lines during the lunch hour.  Had a craving for a burrito and got there by 11:30 and the line was only ten deep.

The servers were friendly and quickly assembled my favorite, the Barbacoa burrito, with the lime rice, black beans, salsa and cheese.  Since we were early, my co-worker and I had no problem snagging a table to enjoy our lunch.

Hmm...biting into my burrito and the beef and rice was not warm.  It was barely warm.  The beef was flavorful, just disappointed about the overall temperature of my burrito.  I've had no issues with visits to other Chipotles, but I came away disappointed with this location.
author: Al L.

description: I loved Chipotle when it first started. I went to the Chipotles in the suburbs of Washington, DC. I went to Chipotle at USC quite a bit. I haven't been to Chipotle in about 5 years. It's because they don't have Chipotles out near the Sunset, Richmond, etc. They have other burrito places like Gordo's and other authentic Mexican restaurants near Church and Mission that I have gone to. Burritos are a worldly treasure and I love burritos. I like the Chipotle burrito, but now it seems too corporately manufactured, not authentic like other San Francisco places. I enjoyed the chicken burrito today. Because this location is in the Financial District, lines are long around lunch time and afternoon.
author: Denise C.

description:
Chipotle. High quality fast food if there's a such thing. I don't like their burrito. The people working here can't fold a burrito if their lives depended on it. I usually go with the bowl, which seems like what quite a few people do.

This location's really close to work and their lines move really quick even though the lines are long. Great place to grab a quick lunch. Decent food all overall.
author: Steven B.

description: Worst location I've been to in the FD thus far. Horrible customer service and I've never been to a Chipotle where they are skimpy with portions. What is this?
author: Meghan M.

description:
So. Rude. 
Wow. I've been coming here for years to this location. I've been promoting the vegan sofritas for them like there's no tomorrow. 
I just stopped in at 2 pm - no line, late lunch .. 
Order a salad with the vegan sofritas which is prominently advertised in your face all about how we have all this great stuff for vegans, happy smile. 
She offers me a salad dressing which is not vegan friendly and I decline. I tell the next guy my toppings and ask for a little extra fire roasted salsa but he said no he already closed up my salad and slopped some into a salsa container. Ok. That's ok. 
Get to register. Ask cashier girl if there is another salad dressing Bc the one they have isnt vegan friendly. She made a snarky comment and literally said 'I don't really work here'.  I said 'I'm paying you and you don't work here?'  Then she looked at guy behind me (Bc I was such a problem) and put her hands up at me and said 'I don't have ANYTHING to do with that, I don't make ANY decisions about that or anything else'.  I said and smiled ,  'I realize that and I was just asking and communicating that since you have a huge billboard about how great you are, maybe you could have another salad dressing option'. 
That really threw her off and she dismissed me very ungraciously by simply moving on to the guy behind me in total silence and then saying after I started to walk away that I should go to the website.
I'm not a psycho militant vegan. I do this for peaceful and ethical purposes. If chipotle is going to push their vegan options soooooo much that they even gave them away FREE a few weeks ago, don't act like I am asking such an outlandish question regarding a vegan option. But mostly ... Don't allow your bitchy millenials to interface with your customers.
Really poor customer service.

Ps - the iceberg lettuce was really brown.
author: Christine B.

description:
I love chipotle. I'm not going to comment on the food - it's a chain, you know what you'e getting yourself into.

What I do have to say is about this particular location. If you're stoping here for lunch on a workday, expect a long line. But don't be intimidated. The line many go out the door but trust me... I speak from experience... you'll be at the cash register in under 7 minutes. This place churns out burritos faster than I can finish up that oneeeee email in line.

Happy eating!
author: Erica W.

description: this was the worst chipotle experience ever. the staff was extremely apathetic and did not care if I got my food or not. when I went they were out of corn salsa and guac!!! I go to chipotle specifically for the guac! my burrito was small and I received no discount after asking if I could get money off bc they were out of so many ingredients. horrible.
author: Rachel F.

description: First time ever coming to a Chipotle and it was a good one! From inside and out, this Chipotle is very nice. Nice little section outside where you can sit and enjoy the view of Downtown San Francisco. The inside is small but very nice and comfy. The staff is great, all very friendly and always wearing a smile. Food was very fresh and delicious. Coming back again soon.
author: Danny G.

description: It's Chipotle guys... For those of you who just arrived in America, it's like mexican-american food with training wheels.
author: Joffrey F.

description:
I know that this Chipotle is packed at lunch time, but overall my experiences have been great- mostly because of their staff. 

Today I went in, and even though they were already busy at 11am, the manager-type man took my order and asked my how my day was going. First off, that is much friendlier than a lot of other places in the FiDi. 

Then, when I told him I was having a stressful morning, he comped my lunch! To me, that shows that even though it is a chain, their customer service does not lack.
author: Samantha F.

description: Nice place cleaner than regular chipotle. Burrito is always a sure bet :)
author: Radoslaw D.

description:
Well, I've never been to a Chipotle  before, but this wasn't as terrible as everyone made it seem it would be.

If you get there at noon, you're going to wait, but the line moves really fast.  Just bury your nose in your smartphone like the rest of the FiDi drones.

Vegetarian burrito bowl is too big for one person, sometimes I get it and eat half one day and half the next.  Two lunches for $7, weeeeee!
author: Monica R.

description:
Avoid during the lunch rush! Takes like 15-20 mins to get to the counter...

Other than that, it is just another typical Chipotle.
author: Peter D.

description:
Sometimes I wish I was a food safety inspector. That way when I see a restaurant slip up, I can rip out my badge and be like "BAM! You better clean up your act, biatchhhh!"

With that being said, my beloved Chipotle has been tainted. My guess: the food prepper was on break. Because when I walked in, only the cashier was there. Standing by the register with gloves already on, he made my burrito. Then he proceeded to handle my money and change with the same gloves. 

I shuddered and prayed that he had put on new gloves before I walked in there.

Should I have said something? If you knew he was wearing dirty gloves, would you have asked him to change them before making your food?

In hindsight, I should've if I knew! I had a stomachache for the rest of the day!! Bleh!
author: Marti L.

description:
Wow..if I could give this place NO stars, I would....

I used to LOVE chipotle...and after yesterday's experience, I will probably never go to one again.  

I was eating my chicken salad...and I bit on something hard.  I took it out of my mouth and it was a bug shell -- looked like a beetle but I didnt even want to study it!! I threw it back in the salad...threw up a little and almost died of disgust.  My coworker that got the same thing behind me said her salad had a different taste to it.  Probably more than one bug in the sauce.  

Never again...I am SO disgusted...SO AMAZINGLY DISGUSTED!!!!
author: J L.

description:
Gave a 1 star review for the online/ app ordering. 

What is the point in ordering ahead of time  when you end up waiting for them to make it? It took longer then had I shown up to just wait in line. Also, never remember my chips at the takeout counter.

Food is good, standard Chiptole.
author: Ben C.

description:
Food: A - it's fresh, good quality, fast food - not greasy.
Service: A -Quick, friendly but not chatty
Menu: B+ -  Focused, easy to understand, has calorie count, wish they had soup
Atmosphere: B+ Clean, spacious, and has outdoor seating available
author: JM H.

description:
I really don't understand the love that some people have for this place. It's not that tasty at all. The cilantro rice has no flavor at all. It tastes simply like whit rice with specs of green for coloring. They use pre packaged guoc and I don't know if it's because they keep all the cold condiments extremely cold or the beans, rice and meat just aren't that hot but my food always ends up being kinda cold.

I've had the burrito bowl which is kinda meh and I've had the burritos which stay a little warmer than the burrito bowl. 

I just don't get it.
author: Hyung L.

description: five star duh its chipotle they wont let me post this cause it to short so will add random words
author: Chris D.

description:
I went in and placed a huge order because I couldn't quite figure out why the online system pushed back my order.  The staff was nice and accommodated our order even though they really didn't have to given the lunch rush.  They were all professional and gave me fax instructions to place an order if the online system didn't work in the future.  

FYI - there's a chipotle app that you can use to avoid the lunch rush.  My colleague tried it and said it was pretty spot on.  haha, they're definitely enabling the Chipotle addiction this way, those geniuses!
author: Anna T.

description:
They're always fast. I'm gonna cut back on getting burritos because after I eat one I feel like I've ingested a block of salt. Looked at their website and found most of the sodium comes from the tortilla -- think I'll be switching to bowls! 

The manager here is really good at rolling a burrito. He does it with lightning speed, but the wrap integrity is tight and solid. Most impressive.
author: Dara K.

description:
I'm a huge guacamole fan. I like getting it on every mexican food I can get. Burrito, Chips, Quesadillas, Tortillas on it's on, or anything else.

So I come here to get a Burrito and Chips (with Guacamole) and it was alright. The Burrito and chips were fresh and good as usual but the Guacamole.. err, their was definitely some weird taste going on. It's like the Guacamole wasn't JUST guacamole but mixed with different kinds of sauces and spices. (Did someone cross contaminate it or something???) Would've ask if there was something wrong or complain, but the place was busy since it was lunchtime and I didn't have much time till my break ended!
author: David C.

description: As we all can now see..this place started off as a great place to eat and with value. HOWEVER, as many of you now see throughout ALL Chipotles', they have cut back so badly on the MEAT part..i think they should call it the rice bowl...watch how they barely add any meat/poultry with their smaller spoon...this could explain why their numbers Nationwide is slowing down. I'm afraid it will get worse as they will do everything possible to keep prices down. I suspect within 3 years, Chipotle will become just another fast food eating place. This is not the employees everyone...the directions come down from Upper Mgmt. The spoons are only half full when it comes to the Meat/poultry. However, they will load up on the cheap rice. The fame is over and for the money...it is no longer a good deal unless you like cheap rice bowls.
author: John B.

description:
Quick service. And I think their prices went down. I would be prone to return here more often. 

Just don't be so stingy with the portions!
author: John F.

description:
I used to not go here at all because it was majority owned by McDonald's, but since that's no longer the case, I've been visiting them here and there for lunch because they are so convenient.

The guy who takes your order if you pay with credit card is extremely efficient, and if you go often enough (as in the case of one of my ex-coworkers) he can even remember your order (although I think he only remembered her orders because she's cute).  But that's besides the point. :D

Anyhoo, their fajita bowls are nice and big and seem healthy enough (except I load it with sour cream and cheese)...
author: Cindy C.

description: Excellent customer service, very clean and the people working there have good hygiene.
author: Adam R.

description:
It's not Mexican food, it's Chipotle. Better than South Park makes it out to be. Burrito bowl is a nice way to enjoy the burrito innards without the calories of the tortilla. 

The only drawback of this location is the ginormous line that next gets shorter. But the folks who run the place know how to make it move quickly, so it's fine. Just be prepared to wait ~10 mins.
author: Karen C.

description:
The food is amazing, especially the Rice Bowl !!!
I'm loving it :)
author: Vijesh J.

description:
Chipotle and I went on a date. Then I passed out because of foodcomitis.

Foodcomitis: 
 
"A state in which a person is generally falling asleep, lazy, and very full from eating a large meal. A large meal shall be defined as a meal containing high amounts of carbs or 600-700 calories.

After eating such a big meal, a person usually cannot eat anymore because they are too tired to carry on.

A common cause of such weariness can be directly related to eating a burrito at Chipotle. 

To relieve the effects of foodcomitis, one can unbutton their pants so their stomach can expand beyond normal parameters.

Also, it is advised that a person take a short nap under their desk, followed by a large cookie from Specialty's."

Sadly, it just didn't work out. I had more of a thing for Little Chihuahua and Farolito, just sexier. I had to tell him "It's not you..it's me. We can still be friends. I'll call you, I swear."
author: Stephanie M.

description:
So, I don't expect a national chain to be that authentic, but at least train your workers better!  Seems like it's all high-school kids here at lunch who don't know anything about preparing food.  Both times, the burritos I've gotten ended up looking completely oblong.  The kids making it throw the ingredients in the middle of the tortilla and wrap it up the same way, without evening the ingredients around.  So you end up with a glut of meat & beans in the middle with just rice & veggies at the ends of the burrito.

Only reason I've gone is b/c they have online ordering and they're around the corner from my building.  The ingredients are decent, and the location and ordering make it convenient, but it's not worth it to eat a burrito that falls apart and spills ingredients all over with each bite you take.  The one other thing I kind of like about this place is also bittersweet.  With the way they shape the burritos and wrapping it in foil, it ends up looking like a silver turd.
author: J S.

description:
My opinion is it's a terrible burrito. You're better off with the bowls.

In summary:
The Good:
-fast moving line
-acommodating workers, friendly staff
-the bowls have everything you want in the burrito, but you can actually get a mix of all your ingredients in one bite.
-no over-the-top prices.
-"healthy ingredients"
-plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.

The Bad:
-they don't know how to wrap a burrito in that joint so it is not easy to eat. You should see how they wrap these things. It's like they crumple it up and as long as the foil will keep it together, they shove it in the bag.
Plus all the ingredients are not spread out well. 
-there's no flavor whatsoever until you add your tobasco and chipotle sauces.
-a calorie "range" is provided for each item, but it doesn't say much when the range is from 100 to 700.


Why did I come here? Cause I was taken away with those stupid ads in the BART station. The shiny golden wrappers called to me. I'm so weak! Well, I've been to other Chipotle's with much better results, but believe me, if I get a hankering again, I'm going bowls all the way!
author: Ellenor L.

description: There's a long line here extending out to the street during lunch time.  I went there around 2 pm, when there's no line, to check it out.  If you work in the area, then you don't have much choice.  Otherwise, not worth a stop.  Price is reasonable, service is efficient, and the taste is okay.  But not much more.  The flavor is bland, salsa has no punch.
author: Mike Y.

description: Great as far as Chipotle goes. Line does get pretty long during the lunch hours. Clean location and an easy meal to grab to-go.
author: Mike P.

description:
Today, my lunch buddy and I had an impromptu Chipotle craving, even though we had just eaten there on Tuesday.  What to do? Satisfy that craving!  

We always order on-line because we love the luxury of rolling in, going straight to the back, and getting our food...VIP style! WE DON'T DO LINES.  

But today, we walked in and the line was almost out the door, since we were CRAVING Chipotle we wavered on our principals and stood in line and got our food... Peasant style.  

We were expecting a 15-20 minute wait in line. The lunch buddy even started warming up, she was about to bust out with her old-school hip-hop dance moves to keep us entertained unfortunately she didn't get pass the "fish and reel," when it was out turn!  The employees are Olympic gold medal quick!  

If that wasn't good enough customer service for us, as we were waiting to pay, the manager handed my lunch buddy her meal and said "here you go (INSERT NAME HERE)."  She was flabbergasted. How did he know her name?  We always order online,  keeping our interactions with him limited  and to pleasantries while we ate.  He simply responded "I try to know everyone's name." DUDE YOU ARE AWESOME!  

This Chipotle is always bustling with crazed FIDI folks looking for a good meal.  You'll find fresh food, great customer service, music you can nod your head to, and a manger that might just remember your name.  Can you ask for anything better during your lunch break?  

PS: I'm kinda shocked that this place doesn't have a solid 5-star rating!
author: Pawanpreet G.

description:
Going to Chipotle for the very first time is like going on a blind date with a dude your friend had been hyping about for MONTHS, only to find nothing but disappointment and perhaps disbelief at the actual results.

Your friend made it out that he was the most amazing person in the world, he's so awesome, totally in-synch with who you are and your likes & dislikes, he's tall, above-average body, he tastes great, and he finds you super cute too. 

Then you actually meet him and realize that it was all too good to be true. He's not 6'1, he's more like a generous 5'3, and his "Above-Average" build put the emphasis oh-so-wrongly on "Above". Like, waaaay Above. 

He may be in his mid-20s, who actually knows?, but he doesn't even pass for a boyish 35, instead looking like he's been forced to live through every day TWICE. Also, he does this weird twitchy thing that starts with the left side of his lips and echoes through his right eye, hitting every orifice on the way there. It's very odd and awkward.

Anyway, Chipotle was a total let down. And I'm never going to let my friends set me up on another blind date EVER AGAIN.
author: Joshua L.

description:
I love the burrito bowls they have at Chipotle since I have such a hard time eating regular burritos because they fall apart. 

I always get the steak burrito bowl with rice, black beans, corn salsa, pico de gallo, medium spicy salsa, light sour cream, lettuce, and a little bit of cheese. Seems like a lot of ingredients, but it's pretty easy to finish the bowl. If you don't, it's easy to save it for later. 

All in all, I'm glad to find a reasonably priced lunch place in the city. Be careful of the long lines though. Getting a meal here might be pretty time consuming. I would come earlier or later to avoid the crowds.
author: Ayaka S.

description:
There are over 500 Chipotle Grills across our great land of ours from the redwood forest to the gulf stream waters. This burrito is made for you and me. So what's to complain here? Nothing, absolutely nothing. It's good stuff, and the operation is a virtual utopia of assembly line precision. It's like when Lucy and Ethel were wrapping the chocolates off the conveyor belt at the factory...only it's not funny...and they don't put the guac in their bras:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nXN5s8fQvHY&feature=related

At lunch, I usually get the $5.75 Carnitas Fajita Burrito because I like the sauteed peppers and onions instead of the beans since I don't like to extrude any noxious vapor during my work meetings....unless I really want to cut the meeting short by cutting one (ba-bump-bump). They're nice and big and tasty. So I got no complaints because they are a cut (there I go again) above the rest of the chains in the FiDi. The wait is not bad even when it goes out into Market Street traffic since that assembly line is so efficient. Speed it up, Otto!

FOOD - 4 stars...a fine fajita burrito...their own fresh-tasting concoction, and I like it
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...what ambiance?...oh yeah, it's fine
SERVICE - 4 stars...burrito assembly the way the Lord intended...or Speedy Gonzales
TOTAL - 4 stars..pretty much a sure thing in an uncertain city
author: Ed U.

description:
So I have been coming here with my brother for about a year and i have got to say they earn the five stars.  I generally don't like giving five stars to chain restaurants, but the customer service there has improved.  

They have been making our Quesoritos with now questions asked and the ingredients of the food are still high quality.  Today i saw that they are now offering brown rice instead of just white rice.

Specifically i would like to say that the manager there has been great, he always smiles and treats us well and is able to handle the massive lunch time rush and keep the line moving smoothly.

I highly recommend this Chipotle!
author: Johnny A.

description:
The food is undeniably tasty, but so is most stuff when you are stuffing your gut with like 1200 Calories!  Chipotle needs to wise up an get some waste line friendly options in place.  And the salads don't count! 

This particular instance of Chipotle is extra annoying, because when you do feel like binging, they seem to do everything possible to make the insanely long line go as slow as possible.  

The payment process is the bottleneck, yet they have 8 people making burritos and one register open.  Therefor, the shame one rightly should feel ordering a 1200 Calorie burrito is magnified by having to yell it out over the heads of the seven people backed up in-front of you!

The stars they do get are for their better-than-your-typical-taqueria guacamole and the chipotle tabasco that I love.
author: Luke M.

description:
Chipotle is my guilty pleasure. 

I know, I know, it isn't a chic restaurant, or even a hole in the wall. It is a chain and isn't known for it's healthy menu, let me tell you. 

This Chipotle in particular seems to do it right. The Chipotle at Westlake Shopping Center is a total let down. Come to this Chipotle and expect fast service, and perfectly tempered tortillas for your burrito chicken bowl. Yumo!
author: Jasmin W.

description:
12.10.10

I don't know why I agree to mediocre lunches.  Sure they're quick and friendly.  I even got a discount today because the lady wrote C (for chicken) instead of (I'm guessing S for steak).  Even after I told the cashier it was steak, he said, well, the system is working for you today.  Whatev, yay, $0.40!

Take me back to my greasy burrito truck, thanks.

If you insist on coming, come early.  11:30, practically no one.  12:15, the line is out the door.

Total damage: $6.68
author: Jenny L.

description:
I love Chipotle. Steak burrito fully loaded is the way to truly enjoy it though for a salad I have to say the burrito bowl is pretty tasty too.

If you like spicy order a side of chips and dump a bunch of the Chipotle flavored Tabasco into the bag and shake - makes for super tasty chips to go with that delicious burrito you just picked up.

Local hint: Lunchtime the line is out the door! So . . . download the free Chipotle app for your smart phone and order via the app and it'll tell you when lunch is ready and saves you from waiting in line!
author: Greg V.

description:
This review is less about the food and more about the fantastic customer service at lunch. First off, as a newly diagnosed Celiac, I've learned I have to be super careful about gluten cross contamination. Eating out is tough, but since the menu at Chipotle is 90+% gluten free, I decided to give it a try.

When I arrived, the line was way out the door. Got to the front of the line and told the guy making burritos that I have a severe gluten allergy (that's not quite right but easier to understand than saying Celiac). A woman (manager?) immediately jumped in and said she'd make my lunch from start to finish. She washed her hands, put on new gloves, grabbed clean utensils, and went to work. A new spoon was used for each addition to my rice bowl and she was the only one who touched it. Kudos to this particular Chipotle for having a process in place and making it easy for me even during a very busy rush hour.
author: Amy C.

description:
It's not the best Mexican place, but in my opinion it's a good choice for a quick meal. They use mostly organic ingredients, and also naturally and humanely raised meat. My guess is that it's more expensive to buy organic food, so they try to make up for the cost by charging for the extras: tortilla chips ($0.70), guacamole ($1.40), chips with choice of salsa ($1.25). The choice of salsas are free with your meal.

Many cheap food places are cash only, so for me, it's great that they accept credit cards.

Some additional info in case you wanted to know...

McDonald's sold its ownership of this company in October 2006, so they're an independent company.

There's a special offer for Valentine's day:
http://www.chipotle.com/email/08-all-001.htm
Buy a $10 gift card in the restaurant during February 1st - 12th, and then bring back that receipt on February 13th or 14th to get a free burrito. They have this offer every year.

If you buy a burrito on February 29th (2008 is a leap year, the next leap year will be 2012), your receipt will have a coupon for a free burrito.

Enjoy!!!
author: Luis C.

description: Ordered online and my burrito was ready at the time I specified to pick it up. Not to mention, it was delicious!
author: Kyle M.

description:
It took me a while to get Chipotle. After trying it a couple of times, it seemed like plain, boring Mexican-like food for white people. Didn't intend to go back. 

But, one fateful night after work in the FIDI, I was super hungry and it was the only place open. "Oh well, I'll just fill up on a bland burrito, then get on BART."

The person in line in front of me ordered a bowl ... hmmm ... and she was very methodical and scientific about what went in her bowl ... half a scoop of this, extra portion of that, none of this, little bit of that, mix these two things and sprinkle it on top, do the hokey pokey and turn yourself around, and that's what Chipotle is all about! 

Really, it's all about finding the right mix of ingredients that tickle your personal taste buds, and feeling good about the fresh, responsibly-sourced food.

signed, 
no beans, extra corn salsa and a side of chips w/guac
author: Rosie M.

description:
i LOVE LOVE Chipotle. from the taco's, bowls, salad, and burrito's. I usually order chicken of either options. 

when i order the bowl i ask for a side bag of chips. scoop it as if it were nacho's.

if you are thirsty the margarita's are delicious!
author: Isa W.

description: This place is solid.  I go to school around the corner, and it's the go-to place whenever I need a quick lunch/usually dinner.  The steak bowl w/chips is definitely the way to go.  Be prepared for a long wait though around lunchtime, and around dinner, too.
author: Mel G.

description: The food is generally pretty consistent so I guess the only thing to measure is the experience: fast, courteous, and professional. The good was great, as usual. Very conveniently located in the heart of the financial district.
author: Michael J.

description:
I never understood why the Chipotle line was so long until today. I've had Chipotle years and years ago and I thought it sucked and vowed it would remain on my black list....until recently my bf had been eating Chipotle. 

We get the burrito bowl - chicken, black beans, fajitia vegetables, pico, and gauc. Its pretty filling and delicious I must admit. I like putting the hot salsa on for extra kick. 

Tip: Order online and pick up your food at the window to avoid the crazy long line! 

I liked my burrito bowl so much I got the iphone app too!
author: Julie F.

description: One of the better fast food chains.  They have the calories on the menu, tons of #gluten-free options and when I left I was full and my wallet wasn't empty.  Good, quick lunch with nice outdoor seating.
author: Heather S.

description:
I LOVE Chipotle, I just don't love this location.

1. I found a huge bone in my chicken bowl that I almost choked on.
2. The chips (part of the reason why I go to Chipotle) are sooo overcooked, they're soggy from all the oil they've absorbed.  Bleh!

Aside from the food, I think the folks who work here are pretty friendly and quick! But, gotta work on the chip making!
author: Helen V.

description:
Whenever I crave my Chipotle usual, I come here and am never disappointed! Efficiently-made, delicious, and flavorful!

My usual: Chicken Bowl to go with black beans, mild and corn salsa, guac (gotta have the guac, for $1.95 extra though), and lettuce. Hold the sour cream and cheese (my attempt to eat 'healthier'). Perfection each and every time, and such a big portion for me I can only eat half at lunch, and the other half at 4:30PM. 

Only con is the lunch-time rush. Wait is always to outside of the doors. But hey, it is what it is. I commend the assembly line crew for always hustlin' every time I'm there!
author: Jing D.

description: Last time i walked in here two of the employees were talking about smoking weed.  Found it to be inappropriate. The burrito was good, but i don't want druggies handling my food.
author: Matt B.

description:
$2 FOR GUACAMOLE????!!!  I can buy 2-3 Avocados for $2 and this crappy place is selling a tiny slap of guacamole FOR $2????  

First of all, the burritos aren't all that.  You want a real burrito, go to a real Mexican restaurant.  

Secondly, they advertise the burritos for $6.75, but when you get to the end of the line, they are charging up to $11.75 for add-ons?
