I saw one dude who sat a few tables down. He was eating (and I speculate that he enjoyed it too) his burrito, when 2-3 pigeons landed on his table. He had to wave them away, but the pigeons were very persistent. These pigeons are tough cookies who have considered this outside seating area to be their feeding grounds. They are aggressive. They will walk right under your chairs/tables. Of course, if you move, they will attempt to flap their wings and fly, which will then scare off everyone within 5 feet from you. I guess my point is... well, I actually don't have point. I just want yall to know. =)
author: Sam W.

description: This has got to be the best chipotle in the world!! The staff is super awesome and friendly. The food is good 99% of the time ( I go every day so that is saying a lot).  They are super fast and make my food exactly how I like it no questions asked. I can no longer get a burrito from any where else because nothing has the amazing flavor I get from the food here. I have been to other chipotles but they were not as good as this one. I almost don't like going to any other chipotle other than this one I can't say enough great things about this chipotle and their team. Great job!!
author: Nick P.

description:
I had a pretty decent steak burrito the other day.  Lunch hour line moved very quickly.  No time for messing around as the gals behind the counter keep things moving right along.  Couldn't possibly hold a conversation in line or I'd mess up the flow.  :)

I'll go back.
author: Sparkely K.

description:
I happily throw myself at the altar of Chipotle when the siren eagle cries the noon hour and I throttle my prayer beads in hopes that my chips be crisp and freshly baked like memories of Chevy's yesteryear. 

Chipotle gives a guy what a guy wants:  MEAT and BURRITO (bowl-what?) and TOPPING and that suits my lunch bandwidth just fine.  They don't waste my time with endless menu-onic variations of this-n-that that drive me flat out batty nuts... it's time to eat thank you very much.

Do I want everything on it?  You betcha.  Would I like it to go?  You know it.  Need a beer with that?  Don't freakin' tempt me buddy I have a meeting so let's make it a lite one k'?

Well Chip' just stick to your guns now and don't chase any of them faddy Taco Bell trends now you hear?  Us gents need our culinary bearings and you strike a clear line for us.
author: Jim W.

description:
I think the food, prices and location would probably warrant 4 stars, but the service from me at least gets 5.  

The last time I went in here, I really just wanted chips and guac.  In fact I had been craving guacamole all day and even though I didn't really have time to leave the office, it had gotten to the point I thought I wouldn't be able to focus knowing guacamole was only a block away if I didnt' go get some.  But when I got to Chipotle, they had just run out of guac, and since they were closing in 15 minutes they weren't going to be making any more.  This plus job stress pretty much led to me being completely snotty to the guy who was working, who turned around and gave me my taco for free because they didn't have what I wanted.   He was so incredibly nice even when I was being rude - it really made me stop and think about the fact that no matter what's going on at work I need to continue to act like a decent human being.  Aaaand that was probably just the most serious review you will ever see posted about a Chipotle, ever. :P

On a sad note, though, this place closes at 5 on Saturdays and isn't open at all on Sundays, so they're not there for me when I need them the most. :/  Sigh.
author: KT R.

description:
The best part of this burrito was watching Lou and Tori eat the wrong ones.  They'd ordered the same thing except Lou wanted his flaming like a queen and Tori wanted hers tame and submissive.

Tori can't handle spice of any intensity.  Lou likes to cry a little with his meals.  Both were the picture of misery while eating.  

My chicken fajita burrito was edible.  My pet peeve is when they don't manage to get the tortilla all the way around the burrito.  And then don't even get the foil all the way around that.  

Other pet peeve is when the burrito is segmented in the fillings.  So first bite was all rice.  Then more all rice.  Then more rice and I think I chewed on some beans.  I hope to god they were beans.  It was segregated burrito fillings.  Someone let them know that the CRA gave these burrito fillings some rights!

A good burrito maker would slap the fillings on to the tortilla like a schoolmaster tanning some boy's hide.  He'd make a stripe down the tortilla of something.  Then lay another down right next to it of the next ingredient.  And so on until there were equal amounts of filling with equal distribution down the length of the the burrito.  One particularly skilled burrito roller made a lope-sided daisy-looking out of the filling when you bite in to it.  I shall never forget that burrito.  

Such was not this burrito.
author: Christina C.

description: Crazy fast, and yet they still always wrap your burrito nice and tight, 100% of the time.  This is the location that made me a Chipotle fan.  Even in the advent of the taco truck, Chipotle holds its own due to its dependability and efficiency.
author: Gary D.

description:
the line here is longggggggggg during lunch time. HOWEVER, they do have a guy with a wireless notepad to collect your money.

PS - keep your receipt b/c the cashier at the front checks it!!
author: Elliot Y.

description:
Why would anyone give Chipotle less than 5 stars?!  Hello, like favorite fast food ever...

I just realized this is 1 block from my office.  I might as well just cancel my gym membership now since any physical activity will be immediately cancelled out by my frequent trips to the Market Street location.  

I do have to gripe about the annoying metal ramps in the door.  Is this some "handicap accessible" thing?  If so, great.  If not, ummm, could you get rid of them so that every time I walk in with heels on, I don't cause heads to turn because of the crazy cacophony that heels on a steel ramp cause?

Favorite thing ever: barbacoa + hot sauce + cheese + lettuce.  And that rice.  I can not get enough of that starchy white stuff.  High glycemic index?  Couldn't care less.  Gotta get my burrito fix!  (Do I sound like a drug addict?...)

I get really excited just thinking about this place.

Oh, yum!
author: Lindsay M.

description:
Holy rushing line, Batman! I am surprised Chipotle does not have a cowhand with a whip, cracking it to make the line move even faster. I barely had time to look at the menu as I whizzed past, and practically had to jump the counter to keep the burrito lady from dousing my lunch with mild salsa. This gringa likes it hot! Just 'cause I'm white doesn't mean I can't handle the burn, baby. I actually got my food at a 10 cent cheaper price, because the woman at the register did not want to wait the extra 2/10 of a second for me to get a dime out of my wallet to top off the bills I handed her.

You know, if I wanted to be herded through the ordering process like someone was going to shoot me if I didn't break the world record for speed,  I would go to Chipotle in Manhattan. This is California! Slow it down, man.

I have to say though, I was really surprised by the tastiness of the food. Sure, it was probably MSG, and the spices were probably harvested by blind 4 year old refugees in Myanmar- I know Chipotle is owned by the evil MacDonald's empire, but it wasn't half bad. And it's a two second walk from my office, and they have a nice little outdoor patio.

Next time I go I am getting the tacos. Fewer ingredients to consider- maybe I can keep up with the staff.
author: Angie R.

description: Its Chipotle, nothing more, nothing less.  You can avoid the lines by going a before 12 or after 1.  Its pretty standard and you know what to expect when you get there, some of that new cali mex taste.. Not real mexican food, but it hits the spot when you are hungry and want mexican-ish food but not the whole weight of sauces and cheese.  If you want an authentic feeling, go to Rico-Mex, right down the alley way.
author: Ronjini M.

description:
Why do people keep telling me they love Chipotle?

This place BLOWS.  Long lines, owned by mickey d's, lots of calories, and overall mediocrity.  

Hey financial district crowd, why don't you save the 20 minutes you're waiting in line for this crap and hop a BART over to the Mission and get some REAL Mexican food??
author: Julie L.

description:
I actually dig Chipotle despite the assembly line, chain restaurant-esqe feel. The mexican girls behind the counter always giggle and stare at me when I go in. This makes me feel kind of awkward, and they speak Spanish to each other so I have no clue what they are saying. I typically go here after a good workout at the gym. Beans, chicken, rice. All good stuff for a post-workout meal. And whats up with putting diced red onions in the corn/vegetable medley? Lame.

** Help! My hand and peini are fighting. Get some help, a hot towel, and a chicken burrito this is gonna be a battle royal.**
author: Mike S.

description:
come on people, why would you order a Mcburrito?  Can't you be creative enough in this city to get your mexican food from MEXICAN RESTAURANTS and not a mcdonald's chain?  THere are soooooo many damn good taquerias in this city....try one.  Cancun, Farolito, Papalote.  Please, I know you just lost your senses and got caught up in this McCulture, but please, for us all, don't do it again.
thank you for reading this public service announcement.
author: Jonathan R.

description: I'm hoping they do a better job earlier in the day than when I came. It was 7:30 when I came in, half an hour before closing. I was obviously slowing down their closing routine. The lady ahead of me in line ordered a salad - the cashier said they were out of some of the vegetables and shrugged her shoulders. Reluctantly, she turned around with a sigh to ask the guy in the kitchen if he could get some more out. Fortunately, they still had everything to make a burrito when I ordered. It was cold, but it was all there. I'm sure it's better earlier in the day when everything is still hot.
author: Matt W.

description:
It's a chain, so you either like that or you don't. I've never really thought much of it having always ordered the burrito or the burrito bowl and feeling like I ate way too much.

I didn't pick the place, I was just along for the walk. But this time I tried the tacos (beef) with sour cream and guacamole. They actually tasted great. I was shocked. I'm looking forward to going back for more tacos.

It was nice not being loaded down with rice and beans.
author: Randy W.

description:
Do you work downtown?  Are you tired of spending literally dozens of seconds ordering your burritos?  Are you the kind of person who knows exactly what he/she wants?

Well, Sir (or Ma'am), Chipotle might be for you.

I recently learned that Chipotle is owned by McDonald's Corporation.  I only have two questions for Mr. Ronald McDonald: Why wouldn't McDonald's restaurants serve healthy food and why aren't McDonald's restaurants as efficient as Chipotle?

When you walk into Chipotle, you see the faux wood and aluminum decor which screams "cheap."  "Cheapotle," if you will.  Yes, that WAS bad.  

It is a fast food place, though, so what do you expect?  Then you notice an battalion of people behind the counter, each person armed and dangerous (their weapons range from ladle to aluminum foil).  Fast, easy, efficient.

Here's where Chipotle gets tricky: before you step up to the counter, you'd better be damn sure you know EXACTLY what you want.  Don't think and don't blink, just answer questions.  "Bowl."  "White Rice."  "Chicken."  "Red Salsa"  "No cheese."  "Guacamole."  You pay, you're done.

I had a burrito bowl, which tasted pretty good.  The chicken was tender, although the white rice was slightly overcooked.  Guacamole was very tasty, although the lettuce was lacking in freshness.  I do like the idea of burrito in a bowl, however: you eat it with a fork, and it feels like you're having a real meal.

I would have liked to have known ahead of time that guacamole was extra $1.10.  It's not about the extra $1; it's about the sticker shock.  I bet it's posted somewhere, but who can read that fast?  You've got to move quickly, lest the Chipotle conveyor belt hurts you.

This place is also relatively small, so prepare to fight for your right to sit at the table.  There's also a small outdoor patio with 10 or so tables.  Get there early and enjoy!

In summary: not bad for a fast food place, but don't expect an authentic Mexican meal.  And decide what you want, damn it!
author: Yan G.

description:
Authentic? Course not. Delicious? Yes. 

I'm sitting here eating a barbacoa burrito bigger than my head. If you want real Mexican, go to the Mission. But for an awesome lunchtime burrito, Chipotle rocks.
author: Shoshana D.

description: I haven't been to a Chipotle in years and this one is right across the street from my job.  I had their barbacoa tacos with cheese and DAMN that was good.  I'm actually satisfied with the portion size as well.  They stay open till 8 and have outdoor seating.  They also serve beer!  This place could actually be dangerous for me?!
author: Corey V.

description: Food gets 5 stars, unfortunately have to deduct one star since the manager-type guy strolls around the place in hideous red Crocs.
author: Tony T.

description:
Having a bad morning, go here for lunch!

The staff here is amazing. Kindest group of people I've encountered at a food place.  I don't have to preach about the food because its always good, its definitely the staff that makes this my favorite place for lunch.
author: Jason H.

description:
I'm looking at the 1-3 stars rating and I'm surprised! This place is great  for "I've got 30 minutes to eat and grab lunch to go" because seriously, you better know what you're going to order the minute you step into the restaurant because the line will move fast FAst FAST! You won't have time to think about what kind of beans or meat you want. the workers will speak so fast in english you might mistake it for spanish. 

I've never ordered anything besides the Burrito BOL - basically the contents of a burrito without the tortilla. You can order chips on the side to dip into the bowl for an extra 1.25; perhaps a side of guac as well, since there is no guac in the bowl. Anyway, tasty and spicy then maybe an experience of heartburn to end the meal = P

I guess I like it a lot because it's just across the street from where I work, while the next closest taqueria is probably a 20 minute muni ride away (mission/castro district).
author: Oanh N.

description:
I ate here for the first time today. I've heard mixed reviews about the place so I didn't have any expectations. I got the salad with carnitas, sour cream, cheese, and guac. $1.40 extra for the guac is pricey considering the base price is $6.

The lettuce was fresh, but there wasn't enough considering how salty the carnitas was. It was like eating shredded pork shaped salt. I didn't need any dressing if I ate even a small chunk of the meat and I had to dilute the saltiness with the lettuce, guac, and tomatoes.

Half the group I ate with really liked their food so the mixed reviews are common I guess. 

The decor was simple and clean, but the table space was really limited. The staff was not the friendliest, but they weren't rude either.   

A slightly less than average rating for a slightly less than average food and service.
author: Seri T.

description:
CATTLE CALL!!! This place is totally chaotic at lunchtime....If you don't mind lots of people, yet fast moving lines, and relatively healthy food, this might be your favorite Fi-Di place.

That's how i feel when i come here....it's such a convenient location, and a reasonably healthy Americanized-mexican-style food.  I personally have a yearning for their roasted corn salsa.  Might not be genuine but goes oh-so-well on my fajita-style chicken burrito.

Granted, there is a  lack of ambiance, but what does one expect from a McDonald's corporation owned set of franchises.

In any case, I'll probably continue to come back as long as I am working downtown.
author: Jane A.

description:
This place gets PACKED at lunch, the line literally out the door and onto the sidewalk.  But man, are they fast!  Sidewalk to cashier in 15 minutes, no joke.  You better know what you want, though, because once you get up to the counter they whiz you through.  The pressure!

Be careful with your calories here, this is not a low-cal option for lunch.  Although the ingredients are fresh, the lowest you can get away with is about 575.  That's three soft tacos, rice and beans, fajita veggies.  No meat, no cheese, no sour cream, no guacamole.  To give you an idea - a chicken burrito with rice, beans, cheese and sour cream is 850 calories!!!
author: Rachel P.

description:
Chipotle is a national chain that serves San Francisco style burritos. Got that? They are a chain that makes a reasonable copy of the mission burrito. 

But here's the thing. We are in San Francisco, come on people, this is ridiculous. Its like going to china and eating at Panda Express, Domino's in New York, Olive Garden in Italy. Its not because its not authentic. I don't care about authentic. Its because this is our local cuisine and you should support the home team. Its better anyway.

 If you are in Tulsa, by all means eat at Chipotle's, its the closest thing to a san francisco burrito you can get. If you work in the FiDi I forgive you, because you have to eat. But just recognize this is an imitation of a local specialty.

But in San Francisco its kind of a crime to eat there. Anyway, another note, McDonald's is divested of Chipotle.
author: Stephen W.

description:
Premium Fast Food Mexican

First time to this joint - there was a cafeteria line type atmosphere - designed specifically for the corporate grab and go lunch.  Pretty much only a few basic essentials on the wall - burrito, taco, burrito bowl, salad.  In fear of the hit-and-run afternoon siesta, I actually opted for the salad.  

And was quite pleased.  It was easy to follow the gravy train as they added condiments ala carte.  YOU GOTTA GET THE CARNITAS (pork).  It was tender, pulled pork, seasoned and soft.  Though the salad itself was small, the portion of meat was healthy.  Although I can see quantity variations based on how crowded and busy they were.  You can add  beans, salsa, and this corn salsa to it too, free I believe.  Watch out for the guac - I thought it was free, but at the register, they tacked on $1.40 for a gob of it.  But still, $1.40?  I like the green concoction as the next guy, but $1.40?  I ain't trying to be cheap, but I ain't trying to be stupid neither.  The salad was in the upper $5.

The area sits right there on Market street with a lot of moving visuals.  Indoor seating is plentiful as is the courtyard right in front.  The place is super clean with welcoming booths and tables.  Sterile and modern.

I really can't complain.  Definitely trying the carnitas burrito next time.
author: Isaac L.

description:
A little scoop of salty, savory heaven in a bowl. 

Cilantro lime rice - yum.
Marinated Steak - delish.
Corn Salsa - prrrrr.

Tip:  download the fax order form off their website and fax in your order.   You walk past the 20 yard line and to the side window in the back - no line, no wait.
author: Fräulein J.

description: Love this place. The Manager is SO nice & friendly! Great healthy lunch. Chipotle has amazing business practices with organic/humane/free range foods.
author: Heather M.

description:
I deducted one star because they are a chain restaurant and they are owned by Mcdonalds...

BUT THEY ARE SOOO FRIGGIN GOOD!!! 

I am a fan of the mom and pop burritto places around the city, but sometimes I get kinda freaked out by thier sanitation (or lack thereof) practices. At Chiptotle, the worries are eased away. I know the place is fucking sterile (My friend worked at one, and they literally disinfect EVERYTHING in that fucking place)

I love the cilantro rice (not the sticky gummi rice from the usual local taquerias), the shredded pork is lean and flavorful, the pinto beans are smoky and have just the right amount of kick to it, the guacamole is fresh and chunky.

My only complaint is that they dont melt the cheese...and its owned by Mcdonalds.
author: Keila E.

description:
I love this place! I've tried other fast food Mexican joints, but this place is my favorite! 

The food is delicious and very good quality. It also comes fast and is very reasonably priced. They also serve alcoholic beverages!!! LOL.

My favorte is the Steak Burrito Fajita Style. You gotta try it! I hope they open up more establishments -- especially around the Sunset.
author: MishEddie G.

description: I thought Chipotle would be a disgusting chain but I guess I was wrong . The food here is actually decent . I had the chicken bowl and it tasted pretty standard ... the chicken was pretty good . However , I think I would still pick Rubios over Chipotle ...
author: Eileen L.

description: this is my favorite location on the block. . . every time i come here i get treated great and i remember . grill guy in back does it right . i see him back there fully into it
author: Wdfa W.

description:
Loud techno, strangely sterile setting, grumpy employees, and $8 for a burrito (without guacamole) and a drink....I say, no, no Senor!  This was my first visit to Chipotle and I don't see what the fuss is about.  The food was okay (I'm not a fan of that sauce dripping on the meat) but we are living in San Francisco, people!  We have other options.  :)

The two things I *did* like were the rice - white, glistening, sprinkled with chopped cilantro - and the fact that the steak is free of hormones and antibiotics.  I was tempted to give another star just for that.  But everything else was just okay, and over-priced.
author: akimbo j.

description:
This is the only thing close to "fast food" that I eat. 

It's not the best food in the world. The menu is basic and most things could use more flavor. But the ingredients are fresh and healthy, the food is made to order, the place is clean, they have good brewed ice tea, and the portions are fairly generous for the price.  No real complaints.

Side note: McDonalds doesn't own Chipotle, they made an investment in it a while ago, and divested when the company went public.
author: Jeffrey F.

description:
Quick update to my original 4/18/08 post:

Chipotle is NO LONGER A SISTER COMPANY OF McDONALD's... McDonald's sold their stake in Chipotle in October '06, and the Fresh-Mex chain has thrived independently ever since.

Please forgive me, all-powerful manager, Evange!

Still a big fan of the steak tacos and chips w/ guac...

-MS
author: Mitch S.

description: Honestly, I realize Chipotle is a chain and I realize that there are awesome authentic burrito places in the Mission. However, I'm still going to admit that I love Chipotle. It's never let me down, and has always satisfied my cravings for a burrito, taco, or taco salad. YUM!! The prices are average, the burrito makers are friendly, it's always clean inside and welcoming. I especially love their veggie fajita burrito w/ black beans medium salsa and everything on it. They serve you up a whole lot for your money, which is nice and fattening all in one! But hey, once in awhile it's okay right?? They also give you free sides of salsa, which seems rare these days with the hole in the wall places.  When I was in college living in Santa Barbara, they would always throw in a complementary drink b/c I was a student! Now, I don't drink soft drinks so it's not a big deal that I'm old. But yea, I do love this place because it's good every time!
author: Sonya D.

description: I eat here like 3 times a week minimum.  It's 3 blocks from work, and I have a Chipotle craving 24/7, so what's not to love?  I usually take lunch outside of the normal lunch rush, so I never have a problem with long lines.  I get the Barbacoa Burrito Bowl with guac, and it tastes so good every time.  My only complaint would be the snarky little guy who works the line in the afternoon.  The attitude can go, my friend.  But I won't let him ruin my love affair with Chipotle.
author: Tim F.

description: You really could do a lot worse with chain "Mexican" restaurants. But the barbacoa bowl is large-ish, decent tasting, and fairly priced. For SF anyway.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Alright look I know Chipotle is not authentic mexican food. I know you can go to the mission and get a burrito that maybe is a little bit better and maybe a buck cheaper. But for basically being a fast food mexican restaurant I don't get how you can bad mouth this place.

They use good fresh ingredients. The place is clean (which you can't say about most of those mission places). And it's worlds above taco bell.

The only bad thing I can say about Chipotle is the locations of the only two in San Francisco. I mean really do you need to put two of them within two blocks of each other? I mean it almost would have been better if they had just put the new one inside the Westfield mall...although that's a bit of a stretch. Although after saying all that I do like this newest of the locations the best at least design wise.

Anyways long story short Chipotle is good like Starbucks or In-N-Out. Not amazing or fantastic, but a far cry from terrible.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
I thought I'd give Chipotle a try since there's always a long line. Today, on MLK day, there was no line and I thought it was my lucky day. 

I ordered a Vegetarian Burrito, which is basically a non-vegetarian burrito without the meat. All the food was thrown onto the burrito - one of the women splattered guac all over her arm doing that. I had barely time to stuff my money in my wallet at the cash register because all they wanted was that I leave. When I ate the burrito, I had to use fork and knife to avoid it from falling apart while eating. And then it turns out the whole thing was cold! Not only the stuff that's supposed to be cold, also the rice and the beans. And everything was tasteless - not mild, as I wanted it. 

Bottom line: If you want a lot of food for your money and you don't care what it tastes like, this is the place for you. I'll be going somewhere else...
author: Rachel B.

description:
Like other Yelpers, Chipotle has grown on me as well.  I'm usually of the mindset, if it's a hole-in-the-wall and you have to tip-toe through a back alleyway to get there, lead the way!  This establishment is anything but.  I usually frequent this place when I'm in a pinch and I don't feel like schlepping myself all over the FiDi to find something to eat.  

ENVIRONMENT:  Situated right off of Market Street, it's in the crosshairs of all the FiDi-ites and tourists on any given day.  Like all Mc-Johnny-come-lately (ironically, McDonald's owned a majority stake in Chipotle up until 2006) establishments, the decor and footprint are very similar to all of its other outlets, clean lines, industrial and metal.

SERVICE:  Assembly-line-like process.  After deciding what you want, you go down the line of burrito-engineers (or salad-engineers, if that's more your thing), requesting the various fresh ingredients laid out before you.  Warning, you'd better know what you want before you get to the beginning of the assembly-line, otherwise you'll be able to feel two dozen pairs of eyes searing into the back of your head.

FOOD:  I'm a creature of habit, so I tend to get the same thing.  I usually get the Fajita Burrito (instead of beans, you get sauteed veggies (red & green bell peppers and onions)) with Steak, Sour Cream, Cheese and their delicious Roasted Chili-Corn (I'm thoroughly convinced it's laced with crack, which is the reason why I keep coming back...not really, but kinda funny come to think of it).

I'm not too wild about their spicy salsa.  It's a little too 'limey' for my taste.  Their chips aren't bad, but they could stand to back down on the salt just a tad.

OVERALL:  If I'm in a pinch and want a consistent McBurrito, this is your place.  As a warning, don't go between 12 p.m. - 1 p.m. during the week.  The line gets ridiculously long (out the door twelve people deep) and you'd wind-up being one more person I'd have to stand behind :-)
author: Bao T.

description:
I usually am not one for chain restaurants, but this place rocks!!  It is affordable and yummy!  My favorites are the veggie bowl, their chips, and guacamole. Not only is the food great, but so are the employees.  They are all very nice, always smiling....and very efficient!  Usually the line wraps around outside and around the corner during the lunch hour, but it does seem to move fairly fast.  They have a cute little patio which is perfect for enjoying a nice cold beer and burrito on nice sunny days.

In addition to all of this, I have to commend them on their honesty and sincerity.  I had gone in one day and happened to drop my wallet in there.  At the time, I was under a lot of stress and didn't even realize that I had left it behind, until the next morning when I received a call from the manager.  He had found it on the floor and was able to get ahold of me through a 3rd party (business card)...  everything was in tact & he refused to take a reward.  

All in all, I'll always be back to this place, and to this location in particular!
author: Rhiannon A.

description: I eat at Chipotle locations all over the Bay Area.  I love Chipotle and eat at Chipotle locations 5-6 times per week.  This location is nearest to my office so I end up eating here occasionally.   The thing about this location is that they have the most miserly portions of any location I've ever visited.  And they charge $2 for guac.  Really?  There are other locations in San Francisco that charge as much, but at least they have friendly portions.  Avoid if possible.
author: Locke B.

description:
A fast food review? Yes, yes it is. My review is not so much about the food, rather the poor service. The food is good for fast food mexican. Love the salad. 

I give the Chipotle on Market a 2 star rating because I asked for extra cheese and sour cream, yet did not receive either. I also asked for extra dressing, which I received, then they gave it to someone else. I asked again and then never put it in my bag. 

In my opinion, go to the New Montgomery  Chiptole until this one works out the kinks.
author: Kris B.

description: A bit generic but it will work for a quick meal.  I wouldn't call it Mexican, more like American Mexican.
author: Jim M.

description: I dont care what anyone thinks, i really enjoy the chicken salad with black beans, corn, sour cream and really like the dressing. Also a little med salsa on the side never hurts (at first). When working downtown, i make my way here regularly. I have never had anything but the salad FWIW. But what are the actual options: Salad, Burrito, Burrito in a bowl with no wrap. Hmm... i'll take lettuce with a burrito bowl on top please (hold the rice, just black beans), and some dressing. Right, Thanks. No, no chips. Thanks.
author: Adam X.

description: Even if you weren't aware that McDonald's has now divested its remaining financial interest in this joint, it still reeks of their fast food stamp: Short-bus menu, assembly-persons en masse wearing matching polos, huddled alongside some watchful, overly-friendly manager with a Hamburger University diploma sticking out of his back pocket. It's crap, but consistent, cheap, and quick if you're pressed for time. So in my lunchtime eyes, it'll always be the burrito McQuivalent to that scary-ass clown, Ronald.
author: Gregor G.

description:
friends don't let friends grow up to be corporate drones.......cuz if you let them, they will be having their lunch at chipotle.

.
chipotle.......it is what it is. an average "mexican" food that is comparable to baja fresh, which means it's good enough for the soulless corporate drones that are slaving and rotting away in the gloomy world of the financial district. i am one of those soulless corporate slaves.......oh, oh, oh, oh, what have i become? help me...
author: frisco j.

description: Food is basically like the other Chipotles, I love it!  I minus two stars mostly because the little drink bar is always a mess.  No ice, no lemonade (just water comes out), this happened many times already.  I'd rather walk a little bit further to the one at New Montgomery.
author: Art C.

description: Good food at reasonable prices with fast, efficient service! Go there almost every week for lunch with co-workers. Love that the restaurant has someone working the lunch line with a pre-paid credit card machine to help keep the line moving quick during rush hours! Love Chipotle uses fresh ingredients! (and that they recycle). Place, tables, etc are usually very clean.
author: John G.

description: I won't come here anymore after today.  I've been to this Chipotle many many times and agree with other reviewers- fast yummy food, stressful ordering.  I was prepared for that.  Today was just an all around unpleasant experience.  My taco were barely flung together.  The filling was flying all over the prep service instead my lunch- the taco had 4 pieces of chicken when I got it.  I ended up with hot salsa instead the mild I shouted out when asked.  There was a tomato stem in my taco.  The really cool manager who was nice and kept everybody moving but without flinging food and sloppy preparation has moved on, and the restaurant was not as good.  To top it off, starting at about 1:30, the garbage/recycling cans were emptied- by loudly dragging the metal cans through the dining room putting a necessary halt to all conversation.  Really?  Fortunately, we have many other options so I won't miss this Chipotle.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
3 stars for the food
- 2 stars for the service

I was excited to learn that Chipotle was building a new location so close to my school.  This all changed, of course, when I actually visited the location a couple weeks ago.  When I placed my order, I asked what kinds of tortillas were available, and I was ignored by that employee.  (In all fairness, I think Chipotle offers only flour tortillas, but that is no excuse for not answering my question.)  Then, while an employee was preparing my order, I asked if they had queso, and again, my question was ignored completely, and they went on to the next customer.  (I was unsure if Chipotle had queso, as this was one of my first experiences in a Chipotle.)  Then I asked for hot sauce, and instead an employee pulled the tub of hot sauce, which was at least 70% full, and ran off with it.  I asked if I could get hot sauce, and again...no one responded.  After a minute or so, the employee returned with the tub of hot sauce...I couldn't tell you if it had been refilled or not, as I did not notice.  Then I asked for lettuce on my 
burrito.  Instead, the employee behind the counter ignored me, and wrapped up the burrito.  Finally, the manager at the front of the line seemed to be telling people which cashier to go to.  He told me, and I asked him for chips and salsa.  He then turned away to have a discussion with two or three employees, while still holding my food.  After asking (politely) several times...I turned and walked out.

I sent an email off to Chipotle about the experience.  Two managers wrote back.  They apologized in emails where literally EVERY SENTENCE had at least one spelling or grammatical error.  That tells me just how important my business really was to this place.
author: Kevin H.

description:
mmm. mmhmmmm.  chipotle.  chip-i-toplay.  chipootle.  chipi-wah?.  

no matter what language you speak, chipotle will always mean one thing:  um.  wait.  hold on...
why does the fact that it's owned by mcdonald's always seep into my brain and try to demean my chipotle?  is my subconscious trying to get me to go to the more authentic taco truck, like, 7 blocks away?  probably.  my stupid subconscious is trying to get me go somewhere that is not a chain!

well, you know what, subconscious?  screw. you.  my desire for delicious burritos is stronger than you, mi amigo.  that is why i frequent this place way more than I care to express on this site.  me and my belly win, and will always win, because chipi-hay is awesome!

chipotle will always mean: a ripe jalapeno that has been dried for use in cooking.  
no.  I mean:  delicious!!!
author: michael s.

description: The burritos here are decent, not comparable to the real mexican joints in SF, but you know that going in.  At least the place is kept clean and the portions are big.  Honestly, compared to the non-chain mexican restaurants in that general area, Chipotle holds it own.
author: Tom K.

description: I had tried numerous times, found OK! This place is very near destination to folks who work nearby Market St., SFO. I dont like the way they cook pinto as well as black beans. Often they mix cheese and Guacamole's container, its disgusting! Salsa is great. Try improving beans like in Rubios Mexican Grill.
author: John R.

description:
big burrito = smelly farts

ps. the line goes really fast during lunch time.
author: Sarah L.

description: This place use to be one of my favorite Financial District feeding spots, but now........No!  The quality keeps going down, down, down.  One day your tacos are poorly made and they barely manage to get the ingredients within the tortilla, the next day they're skimping you on the portions.  I've tried to keep hope, but today was my final visit to this Chipotle.  Should they decide to "feed" people again instead of sampling their food, someone let me know.
author: Michael G.

description:
Would not trade this place for anything. Chipotle is the best!! 

This is right around the corner from my office and i eat here three times a week. Always a place to go when you run out of ideas on what to eat. They are fast and polite, the food tastes great. 

Would recommend this to anyone that has never eaten good Mexican food.
author: Jeff W.

description: Chipotle, Well its created by McDonald's so what all can you expect... you can expect to have NO TA PATIO... which is sooo un Mexican!!!  Ok burrito but honestly $1,40 for Guacamole... lets be serious, i could have bought one and put it in myself for way less, that's just a bit crazy.  Nice outdoor seating, but they need to have a rule that if your by yourself, don't sit at a table for 4 when you next to a table for 2 that's open, honestly people have some common courtesy.  Id rather go to a hole in the wall burrito spot that will have tapatio... I have some for my purse but I did not bring it seeing as how its Mexican food and tapatio is like the ketchup for potatoes.
author: Megan L.

description:
Was here on Tuesday and saw one of the grill men balancing a container of raw meat in the opening of garbage can and then putting the meat on the grill.  With sanitation like this, I'll pass.

Also, when I sent a note to Chipotle about this a hour later, have yet to receive ANY response.
author: David R.

description: I am writing about the long line that frequently extends outside the door during lunch hours. Go online and order. The takeout window seldom has a line. The online interface is pretty cool and easy to use too.
author: T L.

description: the line here at 1230 pm is still crazy and out the door. i feel like i couldve gotten better service, but i guess since they are dealing with lunch rush hour, their main focus is just turnover. i'd like to point out though, that the chipotle workers in berkeley had the same issue and they still paid good attention. anyways they were speed-making, and since apparently all financial district workers get the chicken burrito bowl, they had the whole thing down to an art, with the cashier prompting up the total before you even reach them. i also feel like my burrito bowl contained more food than it normally does, but that could just be because i havent had chipotle in a while.
author: Melody L.

description: Pretty great. I love the VIP restroom. Also, I like eating outside.
author: Scott W.

description: Chipotle has grown on me.  It's sort of my go to spot when going to class (Golden Gate University is RIGHT behind).  I've had their tacos, burrito and salad and all have been pretty good.  I can't say it's the cheapest since I add on stuff like guac...so I'd say with a drink it's like 9 bones.  The burrito didn't blow me away but the salad and tacos were pretty good.  I think the burrito has too much rice or something.....I'm a La Taqueria girl so filler doesn't do it for me.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
holy fuck that was the best burrito bowl i've ever had.
holy fuck that was the ONLY burrito bowl i've ever had.
the godfather knows how to do mexican food.
author: Kiya B.

description:
The food tastes okay here; the main reason people come here is because:
-It doesn't try to be authentically Mexican, and some think it stands out that way.
-It's a decent deal for guaranteed fullness.
-It's fast(although the lines do typically go out the door during the lunch hour).

Those are the pros.  The cons are:
-The meat quality isn't that great; the meat is often overcooked and been sitting out there for a while.  I always look to see which one of the three appears more appetizing on the spot, but none of them really stand out.
-You need to be on your heels to handle the run-and-gun style of the servers.  Blink for even an instant, and your food is on to the next server, and you'll feel bad for asking them to add ingredients from the previous section of the assembly line.
-It takes maybe 30 seconds tops to put your food together, but if you don't get there before 11:45 or after 1:15, your wait in line may be 10 minutes.
-The food is loaded of salt, especially their nachos.  Good grief...

Tip:  Don't forget to ask them for the grilled veggies at no additional charge(it's not just for the vegetarian orders), which are right at the beginning of the line.  Most people miss it and just ask for beans and their choice of meat.
author: Stephen N.

description: I hesitantly admit that my love for the Chipotle chain used to be much higher -- though my continuing education in Mission district taquerias has delicately flavored my current opinion of Assembly Line Burrito Place.  They're consistent and fast as always... but consistency does not lend itself well to positive aspects about The Lunch Experience like pizazz and spice.  On days where the bottles of Tabasco Chipotle Sauce are missing, the score above plummets drastically.  The rice is a little gross and boring -- surely they can do better than to simply add cilantro to it?  It's usually why I order the tacos, but the tacos from El Faro (which, incidentally, is closer to work!) are much more flavorful... enough to give me sharply-onion-and-cilantro breath for the rest of the afternoon.  A lunch choice if I'm feeling uncreative and sheep-like.
author: Adam E.

description:
Food = 3 stars
Ambiance = 1 star
Customer Service = 1 star
Complaining to the manager and getting a free lunch = 5 stars
Average = 2.5

Unless you want to have a panic attack at lunch I would suggest finding a different Chipotle, avoiding this one entirely, or coming here for lunch only rarely.

I would not mind waiting another minute just so I could oversee what they're actually putting in my burrito bol. I guess it's Burger King who coined the "Have it your way" motto. Seriously, it does not make sense to me to order my meal when it is literally 6 feet down the line. And no I didn't want black beans I wanted pinto beans, and yes please add the grilled bell peppers and onions, but no, that would be too hard because then they'd have to take their grumpy ass faces and slide it ALL THE WAY BACK to the beginning of the line (where I actually happen to be standing). For here or to go? What? I don't think they know this phrase. Apparently I wanted a huge brown bag for my tiny ass burrito bol. And where am I supposed to eat my "for here" meal that has been disguised as a "to go" meal? Nowhere because apparently all the twenty somethings selling their souls to the man got the memo that Chipotle rules. Sweetie, you have goose bumps because you're wearing UGGS AND A SKIRT! (that doesn't have anything to do with my review but I just hate Uggs with skirts)
author: Ashley E.

description:
there's another chipotle that's right near wherer I live and i use to go ALL THE TIME and stuff my face but since they were bought out by McD, i don't know what quite happened, it just didn't taste as good....

when this new location opened up, my thoughts of yumminess raced back to me in hopes that the new place would bring back old memories. no such luck. chipotle is simply mediocre. 

i agree the music plays too loud too.
author: Scarlet S.

description:
Yum! A good place for lunch during the week. The food is not fancy or special, but the meat is really good. I ordered the steak salad. When I opened it up it looked like a bowl of shredded lettuce and cheese, but after digging into it and taking a bite, I was pleasantly surprised. They gave me a big portion of steak, cut up into bite size pieces, which was very flavorful and had a nice juice on it (I dunno if this was the salsa or the steak marinade/sauce). It was kind of salty but that is exactly what I like. I was surprised how good the beef tasted as usually I don't expect steak at a fast food place, or even at a Chevy's or other low-medium priced restaurant to taste very good.  At Chipotle the spicy mixture of meat and sauce was offset quite nicely by cool dollops of sour cream and simple, but delicious shredded chese. The lettuce, I admit, was unimpressive as it was like half a cup of shredded iceberg, but it actually worked out really well, making the meat the star of the dish.  The crisp and fresh lettuce (shreds) cooled my tongue in between bites of my delicious mix of meat, sour cream, and salsa. Beware, the Hot Salsa is really HOT! But it's really yummy so I would order it on the side, then add to  your liking.

After I finished off the dish, I shamelessly (ok I was in my office alone, with the door closed) licked the to-go box to get an remnants of that delicious meat juice and sour cream mixture. 

It's not a date spot, or anywhere I'd go for dinner, but I would definitely go back for lunch during the week as it's quick and cheap (only $6 for my salad and I was pretty full afterwards)!
author: amy k.

description: Evan and his team are bionic machines and I mean that in a really good way. Today was our office's quarterly luncheon and the caterer I had previously booked was unable at the last minute deliver our lunch. I went to Evan at precisely 11:45 am (the height of his lunch rush and there were about 45 people in line) and asked him to do the impossible; Make lunch for our 70 associates in 45 minutes. He smiled and did jumping jacks and said let me ask my team. Slipped in back for a minute then came back to me and said give me 45 minutes. I tried to pay him and he said no pay when you pick up. All of this was said with a sincere smile. 45 minutes later I was wheeling a cart over flowing with our order of lovingly made burritos, chips, salsa and sour cream. Evan even remembered that we have vegans in our office and made an appropriate number of burritos to accomodate them. Each burrito was delicious and assembled beautifully. They were consistent in ingredients and size. he made sure we had tons of gucamole and sourcream and as I write this our entire office in a burrito coma. Evan saved me and the day for us. Thank you Evan and your wonderful team for stepping up and providing the type of service that is so very very rare these days. Not only will the great food be remembered but they way we were treated and the genuine courtesy will go a long long way with our group.
author: Eileen M.

description: Yes! A Chipotle opened near my office...reeeeally long lines but it may have gotten better if the newness hype has died down.  I give them credit for being extremely efficient and kudos to the manager who completely has his act together.  But alas, I discovered that the burritos are 1000+ calories and so I must say goodbye to Chipotle from my lunch list.
author: Debbie Y.

description:
Wanna know they best thing about Chipotle? Two words.... 

NEIMAN RANCH. 

NR quality of meat is always good, I wasn't a fan of Chipotle or chipole' (how my bf says it) at first, but then it grew on me, I can't seem to get to like the burritos, maybe it's the cilantro rice?!? Not sure and I can never seem to put my finger on it, so until I do.... you can blame it on the rice. BUT their tacos are good, REALLY good. I'm a Carnitas or Chicken type of a girl, but the beef here is good too. I love that you can personalize everything you want and all the ingredients are always fresh. Don't let the long lines fool you, it goes by quick, they haul you out in a jiffy!
author: S A.

description: I have yet to see a dish served with any chipotle in it! Most dishes could use some too! They use white rice with some herbs in it instead of brown rice... kind of weird. This spot is nestled within a nice little courtyard, lots of windows, lots of light, and outdoor seating. Prices are reasonable. I rarely eat here though.
author: Kevan M.

description:
Booooo! I definately do NOT have Chipotle fever!

I personally avoid this place at all costs.  If you have ever been in for a Financial District lunch rush and can honestly say you have never had your stress level rise, please let me know your secret.  Everytime I give this place another shot they only confirm and reconfirm my originally feelings that this place sucks.  First of all whenever I go I always have to order more then one item (usually a smart observant co-worker who wants to reap the benefit of my pain staking quest) which usually means total and utter confusion for the guy taking orders.  Then the assembly line cranks the basic meat on torilla out so fast that your order is six people ahead of you being attacked by other orders like bumber cars awaiting your salsa choice. Once somewhat in front of your order (now keep in mind if you have two items like I do you are screwed; the second one just leave it behind - there is no chance, it is already soaked in whatever the guy behind you wanted on his) you have to yell NO to the lady as she assumes you want the tomato-onion salsa over the more "authentic" hot salsa, then if you want anything else start yelling cause your burrito is closing near to the wrapping station.  Once at the register a slight sigh of relief as you are alomst done and then before you can say chips and guacamole you are pushed to the side and the register guy is looking to the next person behind you.....sorry game over better luck next time!   I would like to at least say the food is yummy, but I've never walked out of there with exactly what I wanted.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Chipotle food is AMAZING AND CHEAP. But the service at this particular Chipotle on Market is poor. The line is long, but moves fast... at a cost to quality! If you're ordering To-Go, make sure everything is securely closed since they are often very sloppy. During lunch hour, one time my burrito bowl completely fell apart in my bag and another time they put about half was much as usual, leaving me very hungry afterwards, which never happens when they take their time.

It's so sad. Quantity of customers over quality of service. But still good food.
author: J P.

description:
This was the worst Mexican food I've had in a long while, especially in SF.  I wanted a taco - i.e. ONE taco - for lunch.  Not possible -  you get three for $6.50, period.   If you want a corn tortilla, they only have crispy, not soft.  There goes authentic.  The person taking my order asked me at least 4 times what kind of meat I wanted.  I said steak, she replied Chicken?  I said steak in Spanish, and after I asked what was on the taco, she again asked if I wanted chicken.  Twice.  The assembly line after her spooned little cubes of "steak" in sauce - I couldn't swear it wasn't chunks of dogfood because the sauce obscured any flavor - onto 3 little flour tortillas, then pointed at the salsa and the sour cream with the spoon and a raised eyebrow. I said "everything," which was not the best answer because for 1 Tbsp of guacamole, $1.65 got added to my bill.  Beans, chips & salsa - extra $,  pass. Then they stuffed all three "tacos" into a *tiny* basket and threw shredded lettuce over the top.  Total w/ tax: nearly $9.  At the table, I could not manage to pick up even one of these slippery overloaded monstrosities - ended up eating the whole thing with a fork.  Left half of it in the basket, too.

If your idea of Mexican food is an expensive gut-bomb with no concern for presentation or culture, you may enjoy Chipotle Grill.  Everybody else,  get a real taco from one of San Francisco's real Mexican food places, or at least go to Baja Fresh, only a block away.
author: Diana R.

description: The ingredients are fresh and I like their decor and quick service.  The only suggestion I would like them to make is to use less sodium or have low sodium available as an option.  The meat and rice esp. are too salty and I end up drinking too much water afterwards.
author: J. P.

description: Decent burros I must say!  I mean it's no La Taqueria but it's not a bad burro for FiDi standards.  If you can't house an entire burrito during the work day, have them make it smaller for you, which is what I do.
author: Danielle V.

description: Getting fooled by establishments like this one is why I rarely purchase burritos outside the Mission. You will find no love in this assembly line. I chose the Barbacoa Burito and everything from flavor to construction was lackluster. I will admit that prices are comparable to my favorite establishments in said Mission. The only reason I gave this place a shot was because I received a gift card from a coworker. I've got $3.54 left, anybody interested?
author: Mingus R.

description: Yes, its not authentic Mexican food but I still love their salads!  I'm not a mexican salad fan but man, their salad w/their spicey chicken is TDF! I crave their salads quite often too!  It's that good!
author: Marie H.

description: Okay...little secret about me...I'm somewhat chipotle obsessed! I probably eat chipotle just as much as I eat sushi! So safe to say I've been to my fair share of these establishments, and like always the food is great. The only thing that got on my nerves was how ridiculous the wait and line was at this one particular one! If it weren't for my carnitas burrito bowl craving I would have found a sandwich shop instead. And another thing that bothered me was they weren't open on Sundays! People want chipotle on sundays too! I went there and was totally bummed that they were closed ruined the rest of my day...anyhow...if you have time to wait then you should go there.
author: Isabel B.

description: who ever like Chipotle are nt Mexican n dnt knw anything about Mexican food this shit suck
author: Byron Z.

description: A burrito in the Mission would win any day, but if I'm in the Financial District and I want one, this doesn't disappoint.  I do think it is one of those places that you either love or hate, but I am someone who finds the occasional Chipotle stop satisfying.  It is high in calories, so keep that in mind.
author: Lauren H.

description: Fast service, customizable burritos, cheap, and tasty! Excellent for a quick lunch and they got the whole assembly line chain down! I like how it's somewhat healthier than other mexican places and their spicy salsa is actually spicy! I can't believe I didn't try this place sooner!
author: Linda C.

description: Compared to other Chipotles outside the city, this Chipotle definitely sucks in service. After finally reaching the counter and shouting my order, I had to repeatedly correct the worker on my order as I moved down the taco assembly line.  The only redemption is that my food still taste pretty consistent and good.  However, I'm not sure it's worth the lunch rush.
author: Jeannie L.

description: Chipotle is a great place to pick up a quick lunch or a bite to eat on the way home. Is there an assembly line? Yes. And I like that, because I would rather watch them make my food then duck out behind a wall or corner and then bring it to me. And hello... this particular location has some of the best cheap margaritas I have ever had! Less than $4.00 each! And no, it's not a margarita with wine, they use the real stuff. Only issue I have is sometimes I have seen them get skimpy with things such as rice, or they will only put one spoonful of meat, things like that. And I always have to ask for lettuce, which seems crazy but whatever. So yes, if your looking for the Mission Street taquiera experience, get over yourselves because that's not what this place is about. There is a line at lunchtime because the food is good, and the value compared to other spots in the area is excellent!
author: Patrice W.

description: Maybe it's that I go at the right time, but I've yet to experience a line and I've been quite a few times, during the crazy lunch hour. Chipotle rocks! It's cheap, fast, filling and pretty darn good. A chicken burrito with the non-traditional rice, pinto beans, cheese, lettuce and medium salsa - yummy! I happen to think their chips, which are these salty-lime flavored crunchy goodness, pair up nicely with the chicken bowl. And I'd say those two things in particular are ideal to share with a pal on the outdoor patio.
author: Gina G.

description: Went here for lunch, had a basic chicken burrito.  Pretty simple beans, rice, chicken, sour cream and cheese.  Tasted ok and I was curious why I had to pay for the chips...unusal for a mexican restaurant.  Anywho, I was pretty sick after eating here so I am not planning on going back anytime soon.
author: Denny R.

description: What?  Since when did a normal burrito cost $8?  Hello...  I had the carnitas burrito w/o rice and guac, and still...  I was not feeling it, the beans (pinto) are undercooked as a had a few crunches, and they are not wrapped tight enough as they begin to break as you it eat.  Snooze.  Not worth it.  Why did they close express taqueria across the street next to See's?
author: Nicole F.

description: This was my first visit to this location (I usually frequent the N. Montgomery branch) and was really happy to see that there was more seating  (both indoor and outdoor) at this location. It's also located in a sunny microclime, so it's really nice that they have their skylights to let the light in! Plus, during the lunch rush, they have that guy who pre-takes your order if you're paying via credit a la in and out. And of course, they have their fabulous burritos and that OH SO YUMMY guac.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Chipotle is quick and efficient for lunch.  The carnitas, corn salsa and guacamole are flavorful and fresh.  The Market St. Chipotle has great customer service and group orders can be faxed in advance.
author: Jeannine L.

description: It feels like heresy giving 5 stars to a chain restaurant, but Chipotle seems to have learned all this lessons about why fast-food can suck and gone in the other direction. The meats are tasty and politically correct, the lime & salted tortilla chips addictive, and the burritos the  size of a newborn.
author: shane o.

description: Delicious vegetarian burritos! Many ways to get it too - in a salad, in a bowl, or wrapped up. The black beans are vegetarian while the pinto beans are NOT because they're cooked with bacon. The roasted corn salsa is amazing. The rice is tasty but I heard they cook it with tons of oil to make it not stick and to add flavor? I think this is why they have so many calories... as enjoyable as they are I just wish they weren't so unhealthy! Even half of a burrito is around 500 calories I've heard... :(
author: Elena B.

description: Got too happy during happy hours across the street.  Staggered over here and they made me a burrito that was not on their menu.  I told them what I wanted and they said, "no problem!."   That makes them 4 stars in my book.
author: Aimey T.

description: Yummy! I've walked by this place so many times, but never thought about going there. I decided to give it a try about 1 month ago. I got the chicken burrito bowl. It was so good! I really dig their menu. It's very basic and minimal. I do have to say the chips are a little salty, but overall, the rest of the food is really good!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Had lunch here for the first time & it was satisfactory all around. I went with four friends so initially I was scared off by the long line out the door. Surprisingly the line went fast & that kitchen staff is right on it -- speedy!  They even have a guy collecting your credit card payment as you wait on line. If you get there before 12:30pm you have a better shot at snagging a table/seat, so if your friends are running late at least you will have a table saved. 

I had the chicken bowl (basically a burrito in a bowl w/no tortilla) & it was pretty good. Lots of sour cream & lots of loose cheese! The guy taking the credit card info discouraged me from trying the carnitas but maybe I will try it next time when I visit  this place again soon. My friends had the salad or a burrito (which they 'complained' was "so big") & they all seemed pretty happy with their selections.
author: D L.

description: Just when you think the line out the door is going to be a half hour it is only 10 minutes.  Delicious as always albeit too salty burrito and a soda for less than $10 in a hurry I'm in.
author: e w.

description:
While I share some of the requisite reluctance to patronize mass market chains at the expense of local, "authentic" establishments, I also appreciate a well-run operation and consistent performance.  Little compares to the angst engendered during the walk back to my office, wondering whether the right guy made the carnitas this morning.  Little, that is, but the grave disappointment of finding out upon diving in that, in fact, the *other* guy made the carnitas, and rather than a crunchy, juicy mouthful of porcine satisfaction, I'm faced with stewed pig in a wrap.

It's with this backdrop in mind that I visited Chipotle.  Corporate-bashing foodies rejoice:  it's not a trip I'll make again.  

My burrito was worth eating only in the context of earnest research.  Carnitas were OK, though significantly underrepresented in the population of other ingredients.  Rice and beans were tasteless and made up the bulk of the mass.  This portion proportion is hardly unusual, but the combined effect was so bland that it magnified the unhappy situation.  Corn mixture was cold enough to impact the temperature of the total product, and the "hot" salsa wouldn't even register on the Scoville scale.

So to those of you tired of bouncing from one grimy, underperforming "local" place to the next in search of a consistently good lunchtime burrito, I say:  keep on bouncing.  If Chipotle reproduces this burrito with reliability, I'll accept the volatility elsewhere.
author: KJ B.

description: Average Chipotle. There is much better authentic Mexican in the area.
author: Metallic O.

description:
I LOVE Chipotle but I HATE this one.

It's too crowded 

and they gave me much less food than the other Chipotle! BOOOO;(!
author: Ritsmomo L.

description:
The food of Chipotle is good as it was in other cities, but the workers there are still very new and NOT good at listening to you.  We had to say "Midium salsa on the side" at least 5 times before we got an attention from the worker to put some salsa in a small container.
Place gives you a sense that it is a bit busy.
author: Miinno N.

description:
mediocre burritos, odd tasting chips, staff who continually screw up orders.

i'd rather go to the taco bell on drumm.
author: Justin C.

description: i want to vomit all over every chipotle i ever see. this place should be sued for calling itself a mexican restaurant for mexican it is not. if you are in the mood for white rice topped with guacamole that comes out of a plastic bag and craptastic chicken seasoned with some combination of salt and salt, then this is your place. it is owned by mcdonald's so i guess i should not have expected anything better. this place SUCKS. seriously.
author: Rachael S.

description: The chicken burrito bowl is the Bomb! Just wait in the line, it doesn't take that long.
author: Mel C.

description: The Chipotle on New Montgomery is better and cleaner, although a bit smaller.
author: Leslie R.

description: Don't know what all the hype is all about with this place, but it's good for a restaurant chain.  I tried them today out of whim because I heard rave reviews about them from my friends and collegues, but I was not all that impressed.  The only saving grace from here is that their meat is actually really good and all the other ingredients tasted fresh as well.  However, I will save my 5 stars for the best burrito place, which I still think is Pancho Villa.
author: Jim N.

description: SO good, so addicting. Huge burritos. Delicious corn salsa. Great guacamole. Yummy quesadillas. Great rice. Yes please!
author: Alexandra M.

description: whoa...what happened to this place.  the burritos used to be huge...enough to feed two people.  damn, the burrito's are tiny now...and I swear I only had about three bites of meat in the whole burrito that was mostly rice.  I guess the hard times and penny pinching have hit everywhere.
author: Dustin S.

description: it is what it is...  it's not trying to be authentic mexican and it should be by no means be taken for an authentic mexican joint.  that being said, the food here is tasty and that to me at the end of the day is good.  for this particular chipotle, the lines get out of hand which in turn makes the workers at the "burrito line" very grumpy.  they tend to just slap in the ingredients that you asked for and then make you something i like to call the burrito ball cuz it definitely ain't a cylinder.  they are a bit of rip too.  i mean $1.50 to add guac?? come on!
author: Swarup B.

description: it's a great place for a quick lunch in the financial district! i like how the lady walk down the line with the mobile order machine/credit card swiper to speed up the process. the menu sticks to the basics: tacos, fajitas and burritos (bowl options available). taste is good and price is right!!  the outdoor seating is great on a warm/sunny day!!
author: Amy W.

description: I got addicted to Chipotle a few years back and was sooo excited to find one near my work.  I go here every once in awhile to treat myself to a nice burrito bowl.  :)
author: K W.

description: Love it. The veggie burrito - it may not be authentic Mexican, but it's way better than authentic Mexican. Fresh stuff. Hmmmm. This place is super fast at lunch, well priced, plenty of food, lots of light. Love it.
author: Victoria A.
